{{good article}} {{Use British English|date=June 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Philippine name|Dula|Etheridge}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Neil Etheridge | image = Neil Etheridge 2018-05-06 1.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Etheridge after [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]]'s promotion in 2018 | fullname = Neil Leonard Dula Etheridge<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.efl.com/siteassets/efl-documents/efl-professional-retain-list--free-transfers---2017-18.pdf |title=Club list of registered players: As at 19th May 2018: Cardiff City |publisher=English Football League |format=PDF |page=12 |accessdate=17 June 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1990|2|7|df=y}}<ref>{{Hugman|22988|accessdate=12 June 2018}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Enfield Town|Enfield]], London, England | height = 1.88 m<ref>{{cite web |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/players/neil-leonard-dula-etheridge/120247/ |title=N. Etheridge: Summary |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=5 May 2018}}</ref> | position = [[Goalkeeper (association football)|Goalkeeper]] | currentclub = [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] | clubnumber = 1 | youthyears1 = 2003–2006 | youthclubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C. Under-23s and Academy|Chelsea]] | youthyears2 = 2006–2008 | youthclubs2 = [[Fulham F.C. Academy|Fulham]] | years1 = 2008–2014 | clubs1 = [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] | years2 = 2008–2009 | clubs2 = → [[Leatherhead F.C.|Leatherhead]] (loan) | years3 = 2011 | clubs3 = → [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]] (loan) | years4 = 2012 | clubs4 = → [[Bristol Rovers F.C.|Bristol Rovers]] (loan) | years5 = 2013–2014 | clubs5 = → [[Crewe Alexandra F.C.|Crewe Alexandra]] (loan) | years6 = 2014–2015 | clubs6 = [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] | years7 = 2014 | clubs7 = → [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]] (loan) | years8 = 2015 | clubs8 = [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]] | years9 = 2015–2017 | clubs9 = [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] | years10 = 2017– | clubs10 = [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | caps2 = | goals2 = | caps3 = 0 | goals3 = 0 | caps4 = 12 | goals4 = 0 | caps5 = 4 | goals5 = 0 | caps6 = 0 | goals6 = 0 | caps7 = 2 | goals7 = 0 | caps8 = 2 | goals8 = 0 | caps9 = 81 | goals9 = 0 | caps10 = 75 | goals10 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2005 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] | nationalyears2 = 2008– | nationalteam2 = [[Philippines national football team|Philippines]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalcaps2 = 62 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | club-update = 17:00, 9 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 16:53, 8 December 2018 (UTC) }} '''Neil Leonard Dula Etheridge''' (born 7 February 1990) is a professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for {{English football updater|CardiffC}} club [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] and the [[Philippines national football team|Philippines national team]]. He joined the [[Fulham F.C. Academy|Fulham Academy]] after three years as a trainee at [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and made his debut for Fulham in [[UEFA Europa League]] against Danish club [[Odense Boldklub]], though he never played in a league match with the club. While with Fulham from 2006 until 2014 he was loaned to various lower tier clubs; [[Leatherhead F.C.|Leatherhead]], [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]], [[Bristol Rovers F.C.|Bristol Rovers]], and [[Crewe Alexandra F.C.|Crewe Alexandra]].
After leaving Fulham, Etheridge signed with [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] before he was loaned to Charlton Athletic. He joined Charlton on a permanent basis in 2015 after his contract with Oldham ended. After months of being without a club, Etheridge joined [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] making more than 90 appearances in all competitions in two seasons before moving to [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club Cardiff City in 2017.
After establishing himself as first choice goalkeeper, he helped the Welsh side win promotion to the Premier League and became the first Filipino player to play in the Premier League in August 2018. A former [[England national under-16 football team|England Schoolboys]] international, he now represents the [[Philippines national football team|Philippines]] at senior international level.
==Early life== Etheridge was born in [[Enfield Town|Enfield]], London to Englishman Martin Etheridge and Filipina Merlinda Dula, a native of [[Tarlac]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.pressreader.com/philippines/manila-times/20110110/281775625601086 |title=Etheridge: A man with vision for Philippine football |publisher=Philippine Index |author=Noguera, Emil C. |date=10 January 2011 |accessdate=31 March 2011 |via=The Press Reader}}</ref><ref name=inquirer1>{{cite news |first=Cedelf P. |last=Tupas |url=http://sports.inquirer.net/breakingnews/breakingnews/view/20080513-136168/Etheridges-goal-in-between-posts |title=Etheridge's goal in between posts |newspaper=Philippine Daily Inquirer |date=13 May 2008 |accessdate=3 May 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081006181430/http://sports.inquirer.net/breakingnews/breakingnews/view/20080513-136168/Etheridges-goal-in-between-posts |archivedate=6 October 2008 |df=}}</ref> He took up football at the age of nine,<ref name=inquirer1/> initially playing as a left midfielder or striker before switching to playing as a goalkeeper in 2000 after volunteering to switch due to an injury to his youth side's regular goalkeeper.<ref name="XI">{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2013/september/05/fulham-first-xi |title=Fulham first XI |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=5 September 2013 |accessdate=14 August 2018}}</ref> He attended [[Court Moor School]] in [[Fleet, Hampshire]], where he also represented Hampshire Schools and the Aldershot & Farnborough district teams.<ref name=gethampshire1>{{cite news |url=http://www.gethampshire.co.uk/sport/other-sport/keeper-gets-england-call-5364885 |title=Keeper gets England call |work=Get Hampshire |date=11 October 2005 |accessdate=7 December 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131216044124/http://www.gethampshire.co.uk/sport/other-sport/keeper-gets-england-call-5364885 |archivedate=16 December 2013 |df=}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Chelsea Academy=== Having played for local youth sides Cuffy Chiefs and Hart Boys,<ref name="XI"/> Etheridge began attending the [[Chelsea F.C. Under-23s and Academy|Chelsea Academy]] in 2003 at under-14 level,<ref name=gethampshire1/> where he was also teammates with eventual Philippine internationals [[James Younghusband|James]] and [[Phil Younghusband]]. He started out as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] but eventually switched to playing as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] at the suggestion of his coach.<ref name=inquirer1/>
===Fulham=== [[File:Neil Etheridge.jpg|thumb|upright|Etheridge training with [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] in 2010]]
In 2006, he moved to local rivals [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], and signed professional terms for the club.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.fleethants.com/allfleethants/news/news2006.htm |title=20 July – Dream Come True |work=Fleet Hampshire News |accessdate=7 December 2013}}</ref> Etheridge signed for [[Isthmian League]] Division One South club [[Leatherhead F.C.|Leatherhead]] in September 2008 on loan for the entire 2008–09 season and made his debut on 20 September in the 2–1 home defeat to [[Metropolitan Police F.C.|Metropolitan Police]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.getsurrey.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/football-round-up-september-20-4827360 |title=Football round-up, September 20 |work=Get Surrey |author=Blackledge, Sam |date=22 September 2008 |accessdate=6 December 2013}}</ref> During his loan spell, he received the first red card of his career, being sent off for dissent during a 2–1 defeat to [[Sittingbourne F.C.|Sittingbourne]] in a preliminary round of the [[FA Cup]].<ref name="XI"/>
In September 2009, Etheridge underwent surgery on both knees after suffering from [[tendinitis]]. He was expected to be out for the entire [[2009–10 in English football|2009–10 season]] but returned in January 2010, eventually making nine appearances for the reserves. By the end of the season he signed a new one-year deal, keeping him at Fulham until the summer of 2011, attributing his contract extension to his quick recovery.<ref>{{Cite news |first=Cedelf P. |last=Tupas |url=http://sports.inquirer.net/sportsevents/sportsevents/view/20100625-277407/Fulham-FC-signs-goalie-Etheridge-to-extension |title=Fulham FC signs goalie Etheridge to extension |newspaper=Philippine Daily Inquirer |date=25 June 2010 |accessdate=4 July 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100702072759/http://sports.inquirer.net/sportsevents/sportsevents/view/20100625-277407/Fulham-FC-signs-goalie-Etheridge-to-extension |archivedate=2 July 2010 |df=}}</ref> Etheridge received his first senior team call-up on 11 September 2010, when he was named on the substitute bench as cover for [[Mark Schwarzer]] in a home game against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] due to an injury to regular second choice goalkeeper [[David Stockdale]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/8977069.stm |title=Fulham v Wolves |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 September 2010 |accessdate=11 September 2010}}</ref> In March 2011, Etheridge joined [[EFL League One|League One]] club [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]] on loan,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/charlton_athletic/9418465.stm |title=Addicks sign young Fulham keeper Neil Etheridge |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 March 2011 |accessdate=8 March 2011}}</ref> but was recalled six days later without playing for them.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/f/fulham/9426491.stm |title=Keeper Neil Etheridge recalled from Charlton by Fulham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 March 2011 |accessdate=31 December 2015}}</ref> Etheridge signed a new contract in May that would extend his stay at [[Craven Cottage]] until the summer of 2013.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2011/may/10/etheridge-contract-extension |title=Etheridge contract extension |publisher=Fulham F.C |date=10 May 2011 |accessdate=7 December 2013}}</ref>
He made his first senior appearance for Fulham against [[Odense Boldklub]] in the [[2011–12 UEFA Europa League|2011–12]] [[UEFA Europa League]] on 14 December.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/match-centre/2011_2012/europa-league/group-k/home/odense-boldklub |title=Fulham 2–2 Odense BK |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=14 December 2011 |accessdate=7 December 2013}}</ref> On 23 March 2012 upon his return to Fulham after completing his international duties, it was announced that Etheridge would be out for the rest of the season due to a wrist injury that was sustained in the [[2012 AFC Challenge Cup]]. He recovered quickly and on 9 May he has been able to play in the development squad's last game of the season against the reserves of [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2012/may/29/summer-action |title=Summer action |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=29 May 2012 |accessdate=29 October 2018}}</ref>
He joined [[EFL League Two|League Two]] club [[Bristol Rovers F.C.|Bristol Rovers]] on an initial one-month loan on 20 September 2012.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2012/september/20/etheridge-loan |title=Etheridge loan deal |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=20 September 2012 |accessdate=20 September 2012}}</ref> He made his first [[English Football League|Football League]] appearance for Rovers against [[Fleetwood Town F.C.|Fleetwood Town]] on 22 September, which was his and Rovers' first clean sheet of [[2012–13 Bristol Rovers F.C. season|2012–13 season]].<ref name=sb1213/> His arrival at the club coincided with an improvement in the club's form, leading to his loan deal being extended until December 2013.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2012/october/23/etheridge-extends-loan |title=Etheridge extends loan |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=23 October 2012 |accessdate=14 August 2018}}</ref> On 21 November, Fulham confirmed that Etheridge had been recalled from his loan at Bristol Rovers.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2012/november/21/etheridge-recalled |title=Etheridge Recalled |publisher=Fulham F.C. |accessdate=21 November 2012}}</ref>
Etheridge signed a one-year extension to his Fulham contract on 8 May 2013, with the option of a further year extension.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2013/may/08/etheridges-extension |title=Etheridge's Extension |publisher=Fulham F.C. |accessdate=8 May 2013}}</ref> On 22 November 2013, he joined League One club [[Crewe Alexandra F.C.|Crewe Alexandra]] on loan until 1 January 2014.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2013/november/22/etheridge-joins-crewe |title=Etheridge Joins Crewe |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=22 November 2013 |accessdate=22 November 2013}}</ref> He rejoined the club once again on 25 February 2014 on loan until 13 April,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2014/february/25/etheridge-rejoins-crewe |title=Etheridge rejoins Crewe |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=25 February 2014 |accessdate=25 February 2014}}</ref> but was recalled on 4 April by Fulham.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2014/april/04/etheridge-recalled |title=Etheridge Recalled |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=4 April 2014 |accessdate=4 April 2014}}</ref> At the end of [[2013–14 in English football|2013–14 season]], he was released by Fulham.<ref>{{cite web |title=Premier League clubs submit retained and released lists |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2013-14/may/premier-league-clubs-submit-retained-and-released-lists.html |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=23 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150504185633/http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2013-14/may/premier-league-clubs-submit-retained-and-released-lists.html |archivedate=4 May 2015}}</ref>
===Oldham Athletic and return to Charlton Athletic=== Following his release from Fulham, Etheridge used his own money to train with Charlton, one of his former loan clubs, where he knew the goalkeeping coach. Struggling to make a living, he was set to return to the Philippines and had already sold his house and cars before joining League One club [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] on a two-month deal on 30 October 2014.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29839695 |title=Neil Etheridge: Oldham sign keeper on short-term deal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 October 2014 |accessdate=30 October 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/football/walsall-fc/2018/05/08/former-walsall-goalkeeper-neil-etheridge-ready-to-live-his-dream/ |title=Former Walsall goalkeeper Neil Etheridge ready to live his dream |newspaper=Express & Star |date=8 May 2018 |accessdate=14 August 2018}}</ref> During his time with the club, he lived at his friend's house, sleeping on the sofa, later describing his situation as "what you’ve got to do to get by."<ref name="week">{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/may/07/neil-etheridge-cardiff-city-goalkeeper-week-away-from-going-back-to-philippines |title=Neil Etheridge: ‘I was about a week away from going back to the Philippines’ |newspaper=The Guardian |author=Stuart James |date=7 May 2018 |accessdate=14 August 2018}}</ref> Etheridge later reminisced on his circumstances, stating that he questioned whether he would ever play football again.<ref name="doubt">{{cite news |url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/football/walsall-fc/2017/03/28/walsalls-neil-etheridge-i-doubted-if-i-would-ever-make-it/ |title=Walsall's Neil Etheridge: I doubted if I would ever make it |newspaper=Express & Star |date=28 March 2017 |accessdate=22 August 2018}}</ref> He made one appearance for Oldham during his time with the club during a [[EFL Trophy|Football League Trophy]] match against [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]].<ref name="week"/>
Etheridge rejoined Charlton Athletic on 27 November 2014 on a one-month loan deal.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Charlton sign goalkeeper Neil Etheridge on loan |url=http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/loan-deadline-day-charlton-sign-neil-etheridge-on-loan-2108834.aspx |publisher=Charlton Athletic F.C. |date=27 November 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141127190532/http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/loan-deadline-day-charlton-sign-neil-etheridge-on-loan-2108834.aspx |archivedate=27 November 2014 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> He made his league debut, for Charlton on 26 December 2014, in a 1–1 draw against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]]. Manager [[Bob Peeters]] had opted to play Etheridge, Charlton's third choice goalkeeper, ahead of second choice [[Nick Pope (footballer)|Nick Pope]] whose performances in previous games Peeters had described as "a bit unlucky".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.newsshopper.co.uk/news/11689347.Peeters__Charlton_should_have_beaten_Cardiff__that_s_the_best_we_ve_played/ |title=Charlton 1–1 Cardiff City |newspaper=News Shopper |last=Washington |first=Declan |date=26 December 2014 |accessdate=28 August 2018}}</ref> After the loan, he signed a signed a short-term contract on 5 January 2015 with Charlton until the end of the [[2014-15 Charlton Athletic F.C. season|2014–15 season]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/neil-etheridge-charlton-philippines-goalkeeper-2184326.aspx |title=Charlton signs Philippines International |publisher=Charlton Athletic F.C. |date=5 January 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150105173709/http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/neil-etheridge-charlton-philippines-goalkeeper-2184326.aspx |archivedate=5 January 2015 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> He was released on 12 May 2015 following the end of his contract.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Charlton announce list of released players |url=http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/charlton-released-players-2015-2452676.aspx |publisher=Charlton Athletic F.C. |date=12 May 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150512194402/http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/charlton-released-players-2015-2452676.aspx |archivedate=12 May 2015 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
===Walsall=== Etheridge joined League One club [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] on 2 July 2015 after agreeing a two-year deal.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Beardmore |first1=Michael |title=Ex-Chelsea, Fulham and Charlton keeper signs two-year deal with Walsall |url=http://www.walsalladvertiser.co.uk/Ex-Chelsea-Fulham-keeper-signs-year-deal-Walsall/story-26819944-detail/story.html |accessdate=2 July 2015 |work=Walsall Advertiser |date=2 July 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150702185359/http://www.walsalladvertiser.co.uk/Ex-Chelsea-Fulham-keeper-signs-year-deal-Walsall/story-26819944-detail/story.html |archivedate=2 July 2015 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Signed to compete with [[Craig MacGillivray (footballer)|Craig MacGillivray]] for the first choice goalkeeper spot,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/football/walsall-fc/2015/07/15/neil-etheridge-ready-for-battle/ |title=Neil Etheridge ready for battle |newspaper=Express & Star |date=15 July 2015 |accessdate=22 August 2018}}</ref> he made his debut for the club on the opening day of the [[2015–16 Football League One|2015–16 season]] in a 1–1 draw with his former club Oldham.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33744288 |title=Walsall 1–1 Oldham Athletic |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 August 2015 |accessdate=22 August 2018}}</ref> Etheridge credits Walsall's goalkeeper coach [[Neil Cutler]] with improving his ability, commenting that Cutler had "taken me to another level."<ref name="doubt"/> Cutler himself praised Etheridge's progression, stating "with a bit more experience he can go as high as he wants because he makes match-winning saves."<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/football/walsall-fc/2016/10/20/neil-cutler-neil-etheridge-can-make-it-to-the-top-at-walsall/ |title=Neil Cutler: Neil Etheridge can make it to the top at Walsall |newspaper=Express & Star |date=20 October 2016 |accessdate=23 August 2018}}</ref> In his first season, he made 50 appearances in all competitions, helping the side reach the League One play-offs where they suffered defeat in the semi-final to [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]].<ref name=sb1516/>
During his second season with Walsall, Etheridge was one of just four senior players retained from the previous year.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/football/walsall-fc/2016/09/20/walsall-reaping-the-benefits-of-hard-work/ |title=Walsall reaping the benefits of hard work |newspaper=Express & Star |date=20 September 2016 |accessdate=23 August 2018}}</ref> He kept 12 clean sheets in 44 appearances as the club finished the season in 14th place,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/who-53-cap-international-goalkeeper-12991089.amp |title=Who is 53-cap international goalkeeper Neil Etheridge and why have Cardiff City bought him? |publisher=WalesOnline |last1=Booth |first1=Dominic |last2=Mitchelmore |first2=Ian |date=5 May 2017 |accessdate=14 August 2018}}</ref> missing the last five matches of the season due to injury.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/football/walsall-fc/2017/05/02/craig-macgillivray-leaving-walsall-fc/ |title=Craig MacGillivray leaving Walsall FC |newspaper=Express & Star |last=Masi |first=Joseph |date=2 May 2017 |accessdate=23 August 2018}}</ref> In January 2017, Cardiff City approached Walsall over a potential transfer but pulled out due to the asking price.<ref name="farewell">{{cite news |url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/football/walsall-fc/2017/05/31/etheridge-bids-farewell-to-walsall/ |title=Neil Etheridge bids farewell to Walsall |newspaper=Express & Star |last=Masi |first=Joseph |date=31 May 2017 |accessdate=22 August 2018}}</ref> He played a total of 94 matches with Walsall during his two seasons at the club.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Songalia |first1=Ryan |title=Azkals goalkeeper Neil Etheridge signs with Walsall FC |url=http://www.rappler.com/sports/by-sport/football/98213-neil-etheridge-walsall-fc?cp_rap_source=ymlScrolly#cxrecs_s |accessdate=4 July 2015 |work=[[Rappler]] |date=2 July 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Masi |first1=Joseph |title=Neil Etheridge bids farewell to Walsall |url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/football/walsall-fc/2017/05/31/etheridge-bids-farewell-to-walsall/ |accessdate=4 April 2018 |work=Express & Star |date=31 May 2017}}</ref>
===Cardiff City=== On 30 May 2017, Etheridge signed for [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] on a free transfer, after rejecting a new three-year contract with Walsall.<ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City sign Neil Etheridge and Nathaniel Mendez-Laing |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40097728 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 May 2017 |accessdate=30 May 2017}}</ref> Etheridge made his debut for the club on the opening day of the 2017–18 season, keeping a clean sheet during a 1–0 victory over [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40760771 |title=Burton Albion 0–1 Cardiff City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 August 2017 |accessdate=5 August 2017}}</ref> Etheridge performed well enough playing for Cardiff that fellow goalkeeper [[Lee Camp (footballer)|Lee Camp]] was loaned to [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] after recovering from injury.<ref name="asiatimes">{{cite news |last1=Duerden |first1=John |title=Filipino shoots for English Premier League stardom |url=http://www.atimes.com/article/filipino-shoots-english-premier-league-stardom/ |accessdate=4 April 2018 |work=Asia Times |date=18 February 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City goalkeeper Lee Camp joins Sunderland on loan |url=http://www.insidewalessport.co.uk/sunderland-sign-lee-camp-loan/ |accessdate=4 April 2018 |work=Inside Wales Sport |last1=Jones |first=Jordan |date=31 July 2017}}</ref> He helped his club earn promotion to the [[Premier League]], featuring in 45 out of 46 league matches of the [[2017–18 EFL Championship|2017–18 Championship season]], keeping 19 clean sheets and conceding 37 goals.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Tamayo |first1=Brian |title=Neil Etheridge's Cardiff City joins the elite |url=https://tiebreakertimes.com.ph/tbt/neil-etheridges-cardiff-city-joins-elite/115848 |accessdate=7 May 2018 |work=Tiebreaker Times |date=6 May 2018}}</ref>
Following the club's promotion, Etheridge was rewarded with a new three-year contract by the club.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.foxsportsasia.com/football/907505/azkal-etheridge-commits-cardiff/ |title=Azkals’ goalkeeper Neil Etheridge further commits to Cardiff City |publisher=Fox Sports Asia |author=Earl Averilla |date=30 June 2018 |accessdate=2 July 2018}}</ref> On 11 August 2018, he became the first player from the Philippines and Southeast Asia to play in the Premier League,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/blog/football-asia/153/post/3589242/philippines-goalkeeper-neil-etheridge-blazing-a-trail-for-south-east-asia-in-the-premier-league |title=Philippines goalkeeper Neil Etheridge blazing a trail for South East Asia in the Premier League |publisher=ESPN |last=Church |first=Michael |date=8 August 2018 |accessdate=28 August 2018}}</ref> in a 2–0 loss to [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]], during which he saved a penalty from [[Callum Wilson (English footballer)|Callum Wilson]]. His penalty save also made him the first goalkeeper to save a penalty on his Premier League debut since [[Allan McGregor]] for [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] in 2013.<ref>{{cite news |title=Bournemouth 2–0 Cardiff City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45067370 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 August 2018 |accessdate=11 August 2018}}</ref> A week later, he saved another penalty in injury time, from [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]]'s [[Kenedy (footballer)|Kenedy]], to guarantee a goalless draw.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Pritchard |first1=Dafydd |title=Cardiff City 0–0 Newcastle United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45153217 |accessdate=18 August 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 August 2018}}</ref> Etheridge's impressive form led to him being nominated for the August [[Premier League Player of the Month|Player of the Month award]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City goalkeeper Neil Etheridge nominated for Premier League Player of the Month award – Vote here |url=http://www.insidewalessport.co.uk/cardiff-keeper-etheridge-potm-award/ |publisher=Inside Wales Sport |date=31 August 2018 |accessdate=31 August 2018}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Neil Etheridge Ph.jpg|thumb|upright|Etheridge lining up for the [[Philippines national football team|Philippines]] in 2015]]
===England youth=== Etheridge is a former [[England national under-16 football team|England under-16]] international, having played in the 2005 [[Victory Shield]],<ref name=gethampshire1/> in which England and Wales eventually shared the trophy. Despite having represented England at youth level, he remained eligible to represent the Philippines through his mother.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2011/march/09/through-the-ranks |title=Through the ranks |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=9 March 2011 |accessdate=14 August 2018}}</ref>
===Philippines=== ====Early years==== In 2007, Etheridge received an invitation to play for the Philippines but declined the offer, citing unfamiliarity with the language and the players.<ref name=headseast>{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2008/april/10/etheridge-heads-east |title=Etheridge heads east |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=10 April 2008 |accessdate=7 December 2013}}</ref> He was again invited in early 2008, this time by the new [[Philippine Football Federation]] president [[Jose Mari Martinez]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://findarticles.com/p/news-articles/manila-bulletin/mi_7968/is_2008_April_29/4-fil-british-players-join/ai_n35373233/?tag=content;col1 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120717221021/http://findarticles.com/p/news-articles/manila-bulletin/mi_7968/is_2008_April_29/4-fil-british-players-join/ai_n35373233/?tag=content;col1 |archivedate=17 July 2012 |title=4 Fil-British players join football team |format=reprint |newspaper=Manila Bulletin |publisher=Find Articles |date=29 April 2009 |accessdate=7 December 2013 |deadurl=yes |df=}}</ref> He eventually accepted the invitation after speaking to the new manager and learning about the set up,<ref name=headseast/> and after encouragement from Chelsea youth teammate Phil Younghusband.<ref name=inquirer1/> He officially switched allegiance to the Philippines in April 2008.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2008/october/09/international-action |title=International action |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=9 October 2008 |accessdate=14 August 2018}}</ref> He made his full international debut against [[Brunei national football team|Brunei]] in the [[2008 AFC Challenge Cup qualification|2008 AFC Challenge Cup qualifiers]],<ref name="Manila">{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/19741354 |title=Neil Etheridge's journey from Manila to the Memorial Stadium |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Christine |last=Chapman |date=28 September 2012 |accessdate=22 August 2018}}</ref> playing in all three of his country's matches. He kept three clean sheets but the Philippines still failed to qualify due to an inferior [[goal difference]] to group winners [[Tajikistan national football team|Tajikistan]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.the-afc.com/en/challenge-cup-previous-competitions/afc-challenge-cup-2008/19225 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130203142226/http://www.the-afc.com/en/challenge-cup-previous-competitions/afc-challenge-cup-2008/19225 |archivedate=3 February 2013 |title=Tajikistan sail through |publisher=Asian Football Confederation |date=18 May 2008 |accessdate=7 December 2013 |deadurl=yes |df=}}</ref>
He was called up again later that year for the [[2008 AFF Suzuki Cup qualification]] matches.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2008/october/09/international-action |title=International Action |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=9 October 2008 |accessdate=9 December 2013}}</ref> In their opening match, Etheridge got his fourth successive clean sheet, as the Philippines defeated [[Timor-Leste national football team|Timor-Leste]] 1–0.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://aseanfootball.org/afc/news_d.asp?id=104 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101217052329/http://www.aseanfootball.org/afc/news_d.asp?id=104 |archivedate=17 December 2010 |title=Borromeo breaks Timor's hearts |publisher=ASEAN Football Federation |date=17 October 2008 |accessdate=7 December 2013}}</ref> However, in their remaining three fixtures, Etheridge conceded five goals as the Philippines won another match, drew one and lost one, before being eliminated on the basis of their goals scored record after finishing tied for second.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://insidesports.ph/football/philippines-edged-out-of-suzuki-cup-main-event/ |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20110716081805/http://insidesports.ph/football/philippines-edged-out-of-suzuki-cup-main-event/ |archivedate=16 July 2011 |title=Philippines edged out of Suzuki Cup main event |first=Ronnie |last=Nathanielsz |publisher=Inside Sports |date=26 October 2008 |accessdate=7 December 2013 |deadurl=yes |df=}}</ref> Etheridge would later credit his debut for the Philippines in 2008 to his later progress in his club career in 2018 due to having experienced playing for the national team before a crowd of up to 90,000.<ref name="asiatimes"/>
====2010 onward==== In 2010, Etheridge was named in the Philippines' squad for the [[2010 AFF Suzuki Cup]]. The Philippines came in second in their group, with one win and two draws, and conceding only one goal.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101218230526/http://www.affsuzukicup.com/_webapp_740267/Myanmar_0_Philippines_1_-_Filipinos_through_to_last_four |title=Myanmar 0 Philippines 0 – Filipinos through to last four |publisher=AFF Suzuki Cup |date=8 December 2010 |accessdate=27 August 2018}}</ref> But both legs of the semi-finals ended in 1–0 defeats for the Philippines against [[Indonesia national football team|Indonesia]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101221113117/http://www.affsuzukicup.com/_webapp_749660/Indonesia_1_Philippines_0_-_Gonzales_fires_Indonesia_into_final |title=Indonesia 1 Philippines 0 – Gonzales fires Indonesia into final |publisher=AFF Suzuki Cup |date=19 December 2010 |accessdate=27 August 2018}}</ref> He was then called up for his country for the [[2012 AFC Challenge Cup qualification|AFC Challenge Cup Qualifiers]] where he conceded only a single goal, enabling the Philippines to qualify for the group stage. Etheridge announced his interest to join the squad for the [[2012 AFC Challenge Cup]] but was originally in doubt to be included due to club commitments. However, after receiving clearance from Fulham to travel, he was included in the final 23-man squad.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://sports.inquirer.net/38217/out-of-it-all-neil-etheridge-stays-with-team |title=Out of it all, Neil Etheridge stays with team |newspaper=Philippine Daily Inquirer |last=Tupas |first=Cedelf |accessdate=27 August 2018}}</ref>
On 9 March 2012 against [[North Korea national football team|North Korea]], he saved a penalty taken by [[Pak Song-chol (footballer, born 1991)|Pak Song-chol]] in the 16th minute as the match ended 2–0.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://sports.inquirer.net/37197/spirited-azkals-yield-by-just-2-to-north-koreans |title=Spirited Azkals yield by just 2 to North Koreans |newspaper=Philippine Daily Inquirer |author=Tupas, Cedelf |date=10 March 2012 |accessdate=10 March 2012}}</ref> He was [[sent off]] in the closing minutes of the semi-final match against [[Turkmenistan national football team|Turkmenistan]], which the Philippines lost 2–1. Due to the red card, he was suspended for the subsequent third place play-off match, where the Philippines defeated [[Palestine national football team|Palestine]] 4–3.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://m.goal.com/e/en-india/match/philippines-vs-palestine/1265215/report |title=Philippines 4–3 Palestine: The Azkals claim third place in a topsy turvy encounter |website=goal.com |last1=Bera |first1=Kaustav |date=19 March 2012 |accessdate=28 August 2018}}</ref>
[[File:Neil e gk.jpg|thumb|upright|Etheridge during a match against Singapore]]
In August 2014, Etheridge was not included in the training squad for the 2014 Peace Cup, which also serves as the country's preliminary squad for the [[2014 AFF Championship|2014 AFF Suzuki Cup]], due to a lack of first team club football. He labelled manager [[Thomas Dooley]] "disrespectful" over the omission.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.spin.ph/football/azkals-coach-thomas-dooley-also-criticizes-neil-etheridge |title=Azkals coach Dooley answers Neil Etheridge 'disrespectful' rant over Peace Cup snub |website=spin.ph |last=Sacamos |first=Karlo |date=7 August 2014 |accessdate=28 August 2018}}</ref>
In October 2016, it was announced that Etheridge would not be included in the [[2016 AFF Championship]] squad, because of club commitments with Walsall. Etheridge expressed disappointment of missing out on the regional championship, but added that he was committed to playing for his club.<ref>{{cite news |title=Etheridge on missing Suzuki Cup anew: It's frustrating |url=http://www.dugout.ph/2016/09/etheridge-on-missing-suzuki-cup-anew.html |publisher=Dugout Philippines |date=1 October 2016 |accessdate=1 October 2016 |first=Ivan |last=Saldajeno}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Walsall block Neil Etheridge from playing at AFF Suzuki Cup |url=https://www.footballshock.com/af/asia/walsall-block-neil-etheridge-from-playing-at-aff-suzuki-cup/ |website=footballschol.com |date=1 October 2016 |accessdate=28 August 2018 |language=nl}}</ref> In 2018, Etheridge was part of the Philippines' squad that qualified for the [[AFC Asian Cup]] for the first time in the nation's history.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.thenational.ae/sport/football/neil-etheridge-the-premier-league-s-first-player-from-the-philippines-1.758282 |title=Neil Etheridge: The Premier League's first player from the Philippines |publisher=Reuters |date=9 August 2018 |accessdate=28 August 2018}}</ref> However, the national side and his club side Cardiff reached an agreement to allow Etheridge to miss the tournament in order to focus on his place as the Premier League side’s first choice goalkeeper.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/amp/football/46716183 |title=Cardiff City: Neil Warnock happy with Neil Etheridge's Asian Cup absence |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 December 2018 |accessdate=31 December 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== In the Philippines, Etheridge has worked as an underwear model.<ref name="Manila"/> In 2015, he opened the Neil Etheridge Goalkeeping Academy in [[Manila]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/football/walsall-fc/2016/05/27/busmans-holiday-for-walsall-keeper-neil-etheridge/ |title=Busman's holiday for Walsall keeper Neil Etheridge |newspaper=Express & Star |date=27 May 2016 |accessdate=22 August 2018}}</ref>

Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] | caps9 = 11 | goals9 = 0 | years10 = 2015– | clubs10 = [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] | caps10 = 126 | goals10 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2004 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] | nationalcaps1 = 3 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | club-update = 17:01, 9 March 2019 (UTC) }} '''Lee Anthony Peltier''' (born 11 December 1986) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Premier League]] club [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]]. While capable of playing anywhere across the defensive line and in midfield, he primarily features at [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right-back]] or [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|centre-back]]. He started his career with his hometown club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], making his professional debut as a teenager in 2006. However, after loan spells with [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] and [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]] he signed for the latter on a permanent basis in 2008.
In 2009, he joined [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]], where he made over 100 appearances and reached the [[2011 Football League One play-off Final]], before signing for [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]]. After a single season, he moved to [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]], where he was appointed club [[Captain (association football)|captain]] on arrival. He fell out of favour in his second season at the club and, after a brief loan spell with [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]], he rejoined Huddersfield Town.
In 2015, he signed for Cardiff City, where he has made over 100 appearances and helped the club win promotion to the Premier League after finishing as Championship runners-up during the 2017–18 season. He is also a former [[England national under-18 football team|England under-18]] international.
==Early life== Born in [[Toxteth]], [[Liverpool]],<ref name="Telegraph">{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/fa-cup/8290448/Arsenal-v-Huddersfield-Town-Liverpool-old-boy-Lee-Peltier-aims-to-put-pain-of-Anfield-humbling-behind-him.html |title=Arsenal v Huddersfield Town: Liverpool old boy Lee Peltier aims to put pain of Anfield humbling behind him |newspaper=The Telegraph |last=Chase |first=Graham |date=29 January 2011 |accessdate=11 January 2019}}</ref> Peltier attended St. Patrick's Roman Catholic Primary School and Campion High School in his hometown.<ref name="Oz">{{cite web |url=http://www.ozwhitelufc.net.au/players_profiles/P/PeltierLA.php |title=Lee Peltier |website=ozwhitelufc.net |accessdate=11 January 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/junior-sport/winning-finale-campion-bow-out-3508042 |title=Winning finale as Campion bow out |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=17 July 2007 |accessdate=11 January 2019}}</ref> Peltier first attended football matches at [[Tranmere Rovers F.C.|Tranmere Rovers]] and later [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] after joining the club's academy.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theleaguepaper.com/features/6394/football-firsts-cardiff-city-defender-lee-peltier/ |title=Football Firsts: Cardiff City defender Lee Peltier |newspaper=The Football League Paper |last=Ellis |first=Adam |date=26 October 2016 |accessdate=11 January 2019}}</ref>
==Club career==
===Liverpool=== Peltier joined the [[Liverpool F.C. Reserves|Liverpool Academy]] in 1997 at the age of ten and signed his first professional contract with the club in 2004.<ref name=lfchistory.net/> Initially playing as a centre-back, he converted to right-back and also featured as a midfielder for the club's youth sides before settling into a full-back role after being promoted to the senior side.<ref name="pink">{{cite news |url=https://www.pinkun.com/norwich-city/roeder-checks-out-liverpool-defender-1-642487 |title=Roeder checks out Liverpool defender |newspaper=The Pink Un |date=22 January 2008 |accessdate=11 January 2019}}</ref> In August 2006 he was named in the first-team squad, as an unused substitute for a [[UEFA Champions League]] qualifier against [[Maccabi Haifa F.C.|Maccabi Haifa]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Liverpool 2 – 1 Maccabi Haifa|url=http://www.lfchistory.net/SeasonArchive/Game/4991|website=lfchistory.net|accessdate=25 March 2018}}</ref> Two months later, he made his professional debut in a [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] tie against [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] on 25 October 2006.<ref name=sb0607/> Two months later, he made his Champions League debut for Liverpool against [[Galatasaray S.K. (football)|Galatasaray]]. He played the full 90 minutes at right-back as Liverpool lost 3–2.<ref>{{cite web|title=Galatasaray 3–2 Liverpool|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/europe/6201430.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=25 March 2018|date=5 December 2006}}</ref>
On 16 March 2007, Peltier was subject to an emergency loan cover agreement, and subsequently joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] until the end of the season in order to gain first team experience.<ref name="Hull bring in Liverpool youngster">{{cite web|title=Hull bring in Liverpool youngster|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/h/hull_city/6458181.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|date=16 March 2007|accessdate=16 March 2005}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/2408564/tigers-pick-up-peltier |title=Tigers pick up Peltier |publisher=Sky Sports News |last=O'Rourke |first=Peter |accessdate=11 January 2019}}</ref> He made his debut in a 4–0 victory against [[Southend United F.C.|Southend United]] and went on to make seven appearances for the club in the final two months of the [[2007–08 in English football|2007–08 season]].<ref name=sb0607/>
===Yeovil Town=== In order to gain further first team opportunities, manager [[Rafael Benítez]] loaned Peltier to [[EFL League One|League One]] club [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]] on 31 July 2007 until 31 December.<ref>{{cite web|first=Peter|last=O'Rourke|title=Yeovil land Reds starlet|url=http://www.skysports.com/amp/football/news/11669/2632412/yeovil-land-reds-starlet|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=26 March 2018|date=31 July 2007}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.yeovilexpress.co.uk/sport/1929987.time-is-ticking-for-yeovil-town/ |title=Time is ticking for Yeovil Town |newspaper=Yeovil Express |last=Sowden |first=Steve |date=28 December 2007 |accessdate=12 January 2019}}</ref> Peltier agreed to join the club following encouragement from his mother.<ref name="Telegraph"/> Eleven days later, he made his debut in a 1–0 defeat against [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]].<ref name=sb0708/> Although a right-back, Peltier played as a [[midfielder]] during an [[FA Cup]] match against [[Torquay United F.C.|Torquay United]] in November, but switched back to his original position against [[Gillingham F.C.|Gillingham]] after one week.<ref>{{cite news|title=Lee Peltier, Yeovil Town Steve Claridge|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2007/nov/20/yeovil|newspaper=The Guardian|last=Claridge|first=Steve|accessdate=26 March 2018|date=19 November 2007}}</ref> He made 21 appearances in all competitions during his loan spell without scoring.<ref name="sb0708"/>
On 21 January 2008, he joined [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] on trial, featuring in a reserve team fixture against [[Colchester United F.C.|Colchester United]], but was not offered a contract by manager [[Glenn Roeder]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ex-canaries.co.uk/players/peltier.htm |title=Lee Peltier |publisher=Flown From The Nest |last=Whitlam |first=Steve |accessdate=11 January 2019}}</ref> On 31 January 2008, he returned to Yeovil on a permanent basis for a small fee, signing a three-year contract.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.yeovilexpress.co.uk/sport/2010550.liverpool-youngster-returns-to-yeovil-town/ |title=Liverpool youngster returns to Yeovil Town |newspaper=Yeovil Express |last=Sowden |first=Steve |date=31 January 2008 |accessdate=12 January 2019}}</ref> He ended the season having made 38 appearances in all competitions, including his original loan spell, and won the club's Young Player of the Year award.<ref name=sb0708/><ref name="yeovilaward">{{cite news |url=https://www.yeovilexpress.co.uk/sport/2237031.peltier-is-yeovil-towns-young-gun/ |title=Peltier is Yeovil Town's young gun! |newspaper=Yeovil Express |last=Sowden |first=Steve |date=30 April 2008 |accessdate=12 January 2019}}</ref>
In his second season with Yeovil, Peltier made 39 appearances in all competitions, scoring his only goal for the club in a 3–2 victory over [[Swindon Town F.C.|Swindon Town]] on 20 December 2008.<ref name=sb0809/> His performances attracted attention from several clubs and Yeovil assistant manager [[Nathan Jones (Welsh footballer)|Nathan Jones]] confirmed that the club would not "stand in his way [...] if the price was right."<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.yeovilexpress.co.uk/sport/4448847.peltier-could-leave-yeovil-town-if-the-price-is-right/ |title=Peltier could leave Yeovil Town if the "price is right" |newspaper=Yeovil Express |last=Sowden |first=Steve |date=19 June 2009 |accessdate=14 January 2019}}</ref> Despite his positive performancea, Peltier later admitted to suffering from homesickness during his spell with Yeovil having moved away from Liverpool for the first time,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.examinerlive.co.uk/sport/football/news/huddersfield-towns-peltier-life-yeovil-5006541.amp |title=Huddersfield Town's Peltier on life at Yeovil Town |publisher=Examiner Live |last=Thomson |first=Doug |date=22 January 2010 |accessdate=11 January 2019}}</ref> commenting "I was quite happy with my football but [...] I struggled a bit and got quite homesick."<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/huddersfield-town-lee-peltier-interview-1-2237295 |title=Huddersfield Town: Lee Peltier interview |newspaper=Yorkshire Evening Post |date=18 January 2010 |accessdate=11 January 2019}}</ref>
===Huddersfield Town===
====2009–10 season==== On 30 June 2009, he joined fellow League One side Huddersfield Town on a three-year contract for an undisclosed fee.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.yeovilexpress.co.uk/sport/4466934.peltier-leaves-yeovil-town/ |title=Peltier leaves Yeovil Town |newspaper=Yeovil Express |last=Sowden |first=Steve |date=30 June 2009 |accessdate=12 January 2019}}</ref> Peltier had previously impressed manager [[Lee Clark (footballer)|Lee Clark]] during his brief trial spell with Norwich, where Clark was serving as assistant manager.<ref name=lfchistory.net/> He made his debut in a 2–2 draw against Southend United at [[Roots Hall]] on 8 August 2009.<ref name=sb0910/> He was switched from right-back to left-back for Huddersfield's game against [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]] due to the usual left-back [[Dean Heffernan]] being out with a dead leg.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.htafc.com/page/MatchReport/0,,10312~49009,00.html|title=Huddersfield vs Millwall|publisher=Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|date=16 April 2010|accessdate=19 April 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100419043538/http://www.htafc.com/page/MatchReport/0,,10312~49009,00.html|archivedate=19 April 2010}}</ref> He was Town's first choice left-back keeping the position for the remainder of the regular season. Peltier helped Town to reach the play-offs in League One playing at left-back for the first leg at home to Millwall, but was forced to return to his usual position of right-back for the second leg at the [[New Den]] due to an injury to [[Tom Clarke (footballer, born 1987)|Tom Clarke]] in the first leg of the play-off semi final.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.htafc.com/page/MatchReport/0,,10312~51464,00.html|title=Huddersfield vs Millwall|publisher=Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|date=15 May 2010|accessdate=20 May 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100520044317/http://www.htafc.com/page/MatchReport/0,,10312~51464,00.html|archivedate=20 May 2010}}</ref>
Peltier was voted the Players' Player of the Season, in his first season with Huddersfield,<ref name="hudaward">{{cite news|url=http://www.examiner.co.uk/huddersfield-town-fc/huddersfield-town-news/2010/05/04/lee-peltier-is-huddersfield-town-players-player-of-the-season-86081-26368480/|title=Lee Peltier is Huddersfield Town players’ player of the season|first=Doug|last=Thomson|date=3 May 2010|newspaper=Huddersfield Daily Examiner|accessdate=12 January 2019}}</ref> after making a total of 50 appearances in all competitions as Huddersfield finished sixth in the regular season before losing 2–0 to Millwall in the Play-Off semi-final second leg on 18 May 2010.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/may/18/millwall-huddesfield-league-one-play-off |location=London |newspaper=The Guardian |first=John |last=Ashdown |title=Millwall sink Huddersfield to seal final showdown with Swindon |date=18 May 2010|accessdate=18 May 2010}}</ref> In July 2010, Peltier was linked with a £3 million pound move to [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] managed by [[Neil Warnock]].<ref name="Oz"/> However, in August 2010, he signed a new contract at Huddersfield to extending his deal until 2014.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thisisleicestershire.co.uk/Imminent-Leicester-City-exit-Lee-Peltier-Profile/story-16643655-detail/story.html|title=Imminent Leicester City exit Lee Peltier: Profile |website=This is Leicestershire |date=3 August 2012 |accessdate=3 August 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120804171433/http://www.thisisleicestershire.co.uk/Imminent-Leicester-City-exit-Lee-Peltier-Profile/story-16643655-detail/story.html |archivedate=4 August 2012}}</ref>
====2010–11 season==== Peltier remained first choice full back the following season. He received the first red card of his senior career during a 5–1 defeat to Premier League side [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] in the first round of the League Cup,<ref name=sb1011/> being shown a second yellow after conceding a penalty.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/league_cup/8939654.stm |title=Everton 5– Huddersfield |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 August 2010 |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref> On 16 November 2010, he scored his first goal for Huddersfield in their FA Cup first round replay against [[Cambridge United F.C.|Cambridge United]] at the [[Galpharm Stadium]], where Town came from 1–0 down to win 2–1 with two goals in extra time.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/fa_cup/9191156.stm |title=Huddersfield Town 2–1 Cambridge United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 November 2010 |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref> His first league goal for Town came in their 3–1 win against [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] at [[Stadium MK]] on 22 April 2011.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/13090473 |title=MK Dons 1– Huddersfield Town |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 April 2011 |accessdate=14 January 2019}}</ref>
He made 53 appearances for the club during the season, helping the side reach the [[EFL League One play-offs|League One play-offs]]. During the first leg, he suffered a hamstring injury during a 1–1 draw with [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]] but overcame fitness doubts play in the second leg, scoring his third goal of the season in a 3–3 draw as Huddersfield reached the final via a penalty shootout.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.examinerlive.co.uk/sport/football/news/huddersfield-town-star-lee-peltier-4976136 |title=Huddersfield Town star Lee Peltier on the ‘magician’ who got him fit for the play-offs |publisher=Examiner Live |last=Thomson |first=Doug |date=21 May 2011 |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref> In his last game for the club, Peltier failed to gain promotion at Huddersfield after losing 3–0 to [[Peterborough United F.C.|Peterborough United]] in the [[2011 Football League One play-off Final|2011 League One play-off final]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/13489373|title=Huddersfield 0–3 Peterborough| publisher = BBC Sport |date=29 May 2011 |accessdate=29 May 2011}}</ref>
===Leicester City=== [[File:Lee Peltier.jpg|thumbnail|150px|Peltier playing for [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] in 2011]]
Within hours of Huddersfield's League One playoff defeat, the club received enquiries for several players including Peltier. <ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.examinerlive.co.uk/sport/football/news/alex-smithies-lee-peltier-could-4973104 |title=Alex Smithies and Lee Peltier could be set to leave Huddersfield Town |publisher=Examiner Live |last=Thomson |first=Doug |date=3 June 2011 |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref> On 22 June 2011, he signed for [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Leicester City F.C|Leicester City]], becoming [[Sven-Göran Eriksson]]'s first signing of the summer after agreeing a three-year deal at the [[King Power Stadium]].<ref name="Foxes pounce for Peltier">{{cite web| title= Foxes pounce for Peltier| url= http://www.lcfc.com/page/LatestNews/0,,10274~2379842,00.html| publisher= Leicester City F.C| date=22 June 2011| accessdate=5 August 2011}}</ref> He had been recommended to Eriksson by his assistant [[Derek Fazackerley]] who had previously worked with Peltier at Huddersfield where Fazackerley had worked as Lee Clark's assistant.<ref name="patience">{{cite news |url=https://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/football/leeds-united/leeds-united-patience-set-to-pay-off-for-warnock-1-4803189 |title=Patience set to pay off for Warnock |newspaper=Yorkshire Evening Post |last=Hay |first=Phil |date=4 August 2012 |accessdate=15 January 2019}}</ref> The initial fee was reported to be around £750,000 as part of a package worth over £1 million.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.yorkshirepost.co.uk/sport/football/huddersfield-town/ward_is_tipped_for_return_to_top_after_1m_move_1_3571564 |title=Ward is tipped for return to top after £1m move |newspaper=Yorkshire Post |date=13 July 2011 |accessdate=5 August 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.examiner.co.uk/huddersfield-town-fc/huddersfield-town-news/2011/06/22/huddersfield-town-sell-lee-peltier-to-leicester-city-86081-28918862/ |title=Huddersfield Town sell Lee Peltier to Leicester City: Former Town coach Derek Fazackerley on the deal |first=Dougie |last=Thomson |newspaper=[[Huddersfield Daily Examiner]] |date=22 June 2011 |accessdate=5 August 2011}}</ref> On 6 August 2011, Peltier scored the winning goal during his league debut, in a 1–0 victory over [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]], in the opening game of Leicester's 2011–12 season.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/14352025 |title=Coventry City 0–1 Leicester City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 August 2011 |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref> However, the club struggled for form at the start of the season which lead to Eriksson's dismissal at the end of October having spent over £10 million on new signings.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.examinerlive.co.uk/sport/football/news/huddersfield-town-old-boy-lee-4958890 |title=Huddersfield Town old boy Lee Peltier eyes FA Cup tonic with Leicester City |publisher=Examiner Live |last=Thomson |first=Doug |date=18 February 2012 |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref> Over the course of the season Peltier made 40 league appearances, scoring twice,<ref name="sb1112"/> and was the club's first choice right-back, ahead of [[John Pantsil]].<ref name="patience"/> The club finished the season in ninth place under Eriksson's successor [[Nigel Pearson]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/19161868 |title=Championship 2012-13 season: Club-by-club guide |publisher=BBC Sport |last=Madden |first=Phil |date=15 August 2012 |accessdate=5 February 2019}}</ref>
In July 2012, after the club signed Belgian right-back [[Ritchie De Laet]], Leicester announced that Peltier was not part of Pearson's long-term planning.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/football/leeds-united/leeds-united-tug-of-war-for-leicester-city-star-1-4749186/amp |title=Leeds United: Tug of war for Leicester City star |newspaper=Yorkshire Evening Post |date=18 July 2012 |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref> Former Leicester player [[Steve Walsh (footballer)|Steve Walsh]] commented his belief that "his better performances came under Sven and I don’t think Nigel saw the best of him", leading to him being made available for a transfer.<ref name="patience"/> Despite this, Walsh claimed that Peltier would be a "good signing for any club in this league."<ref name="patience"/> Having been made available, Peltier chose to return home from a pre-season training camp in Austria,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thisisleicestershire.co.uk/Lee-Peltier-tells-Leicester-City-want/story-16553582-detail/story.html |title=Lee Peltier tells Leicester City: 'I want out' |newspaper=Leicester Mercury |date=18 July 2012 |accessdate=18 July 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120720200240/http://www.thisisleicestershire.co.uk:80/Lee-Peltier-tells-Leicester-City-want/story-16553582-detail/story.html| archivedate=20 July 2012}}</ref> and this triggered transfer interest from his former club Huddersfield Town and [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]]. Both clubs were reported to have bid around £600,000 but both were rejected by Leicester City who had set an asking price of £850,000.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/19013404 |title=Lee Peltier price too high for Huddersfield Town |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 July 2012 |accessdate=27 July 2012}}</ref> Leeds later agreed a fee with Leicester for the purchase of Peltier on 3 August.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/leeds-united/latest-whites-news/leeds-united-peltier-set-to-join-whites-1-4799495|title=Leeds United: Peltier set to join Whites|newspaper=Yorkshire Evening Post|date=3 August 2012|accessdate=3 August 2012}}</ref>
===Leeds United=== Peltier joined Leeds United on 4 August 2012, and signed a three-year contract with the club. He became the club's tenth signing of the summer,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120804/defender-completes-united-move_2247585_2871481|title=Peltier becomes latest signing|publisher=Leeds United F.C.|date=4 August 2012|accessdate=4 August 2012 }}</ref> with manager Neil Warnock making his signing a priority after missing out on his original target [[Joel Ward (footballer)|Joel Ward]].<ref name="patience"/> Peltier made his competitive debut for Leeds playing at centre-back in the first game of the season against [[Shrewsbury Town F.C.|Shrewsbury Town]] in the League Cup on 11 August.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120811/shrewsbury-live_2247585_2878205|title=Shrewsbury live|accessdate=11 August 2012|publisher=Leeds United F.C|date=11 August 2012}}</ref> Peltier was announced as the new Leeds United captain on 18 August, replacing the departed captain [[Robert Snodgrass]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ozwhitelufc.net.au/leeds_captains/ |title=Leeds United and Leeds City Captains' Statistics |website=ozwhitelufc.net |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref> Peltier made his league debut for Leeds in their 1–0 victory against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20120818/united-open-up-with-a-winner_2247585_2889721|title=Becchio goal secures win against Wolves...|publisher=Leeds United F.C.|date=18 August 2012|accessdate=18 August 2012}}</ref> He became an established first team player in his first season, making 41 league appearances,<ref name=sb1213/> under managers Neil Warnock, [[Neil Redfearn]] and [[Brian McDermott (footballer)|Brian McDermott]] primarily as a centre-back partnering [[Tom Lees]]. Toward the end of the season, he reverted to his usual position at right-back.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.leedsunited.com/news/team-news/3940/lee-peltier |title=Lee Peltier |publisher=Leeds United F.C. |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref>
After much speculation regarding Peltier's position lf captain, despite captaining Leeds during 2013–14 pre-season and for the opening two games of the season, Peltier was replaced in the role by teammate [[Rodolph Austin]] who returned to the side against Leicester City on 11 August 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/w3yls943av5x1s4p0c6p3eyxk/title/leicester-live!|title=Leicester Vs Leeds|publisher=Leeds United F.C.|date=11 August 2013|accessdate=11 August 2013}}</ref> Peltier publicly supported Austin following the announcement, commenting "It was the gaffer’s choice to go with Rudy and I respect that."<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/football/leeds-united/leeds-united-axed-captain-peltier-says-he-s-buzzing-for-pal-austin-1-6049850 |title=Axed captain Peltiers says he’s ‘buzzing’ for pal Austin |newspaper=Yorkshire Evening Post |last=Hay |first=Phil |date=13 September 2013 |accessdate=14 January 2019}}</ref> Peltier scored his first Leeds goal in a 1–1 draw against [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] on 26 December 2013 with a looping header.<ref>{{Cite news | url = http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/t1i8uh7spd9m10m0jli1vytyt/title/united-draw-at-the-seaside | title = Lee Peltier goal seals away point for United... | accessdate = 26 December 2013 | publisher = Leeds United F.C. | date = 26 December 2013}}</ref>
After falling out of favour under McDermott, on 24 March 2014, Leeds announced that Peltier had signed for [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] on loan, however Forest owner [[Fawaz Al-Hasawi]] announced the same day that the deal hadn't been completed,<ref>{{Cite news | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/26718543 | title = Lee Peltier: Forest owner Fawaz Al Hasawi denies deal for Leeds man | accessdate = 24 March 2014 | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 24 March 2014}}</ref> leading to confusion over which club Peltier was contracted to.<ref>{{Cite news | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/26775239 | title = Nottingham Forest owner confirms deal for Leeds United's Lee Peltier | accessdate = 27 March 2014 | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 24 March 2014}}</ref> On 27 March 2014, Peltier completed his loan move to Nottingham Forest, only hours after their sacking of [[Billy Davies]] as manager.<ref name="Forestloan">{{Cite news | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/26718543 | title = Nottingham Forest sign Leeds United full-back Lee Peltier | accessdate = 24 March 2014 | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 24 March 2014}}</ref> His former Leeds manager Neil Warnock was expected to be announced as Davies' replacement and Peltier had been lined up as the club's first signing under the new manager. However, Warnock's appointment collapsed when he was unable to agree personal terms with the club's hierarchy. Peltier attempted to back out of the move after being informed that Warnock was not going to be appointed and had hoped to join Bolton Wanderers instead,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/neil-warnock-i-could-have-got-nottingham-forest-promoted-into-the-premier-league-9222568.html |title=Neil Warnock: I could have got Nottingham Forest promoted into the Premier League |newspaper=The Independent |last=Warnock |first=Neil |date=29 March 2014 |accessdate=15 January 2019}}</ref> who submitted a late bid to sign him.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theboltonnews.co.uk/news/11101742.amp/ |title=Bolton Wanderers move in for Leeds United defender Lee Peltier after Nottingham Forest let-down |newspaper=The Bolton News |last=Iles |first=Marc |date=26 March 2014 |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref> However, the transfer had already been processed and Peltier eventually completed his move to Forest without Warnock.<ref name="Forestloan"/> He was favoured in a central midfield position for Forest under caretaker manager [[Gary Brazil]], making his debut in a 1–1 draw with [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] on 29 March.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/26695402 |title=Ipswich Town 1–1 Nottingham Forest |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 March 2014 |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref> With Forest appointing [[Stuart Pearce]] as the new manager, Peltier revealed upon his return to Leeds that he wasn't sure what his future would hold.<ref>{{Cite news | url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11727/9299902/transfer-news-nottingham-forest-loanee-lee-peltier-unsure-what-his-future-holds |title=Peltier:Future Unclear |publisher=Sky Sports |date=6 May 2015 |accessdate=16 January 2019}}</ref> He made seven appearances for Forest without scoring during his loan spell.<ref name=sb1314/> He later commented that "I didn’t realise how much I wasn’t enjoying my football until I joined them (Forest)", believing that instability over Leeds' ownership under [[Massimo Cellino]] had directly affected the player's performances.<ref name="relieved">{{cite news |url=https://www.yorkshirepost.co.uk/sport/football/huddersfield-town/i-m-relieved-to-be-out-of-leeds-lee-peltier-signs-with-huddersfield-1-6689361 |title=I’m relieved to be out of Leeds - Lee Peltier signs with Huddersfield |newspaper=Yorkshire Post |last=Wobschall |first=Leon |date=23 June 2014 |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref> This included a two-month spell where players were left unpaid.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.htafc.com/news/2014/june/pelts-im-a-better-player/ |title=Pelts: I'm a better player |publisher=Huddersfield Town A.F.C. |last=Threlfall-Sykes |first=David |date=24 June 2014 |accessdate=14 January 2019}}</ref>
===Return to Huddersfield Town=== On 23 June 2014, Peltier left Leeds United, after reaching a mutual agreement with the club to cancel the last year of his contract.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/news/11295089.peltier-quits-leeds-united/ |title=Peltier quits Leeds United |newspaper=Telegraph & Argus |date=23 June 2014 |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref> Despite interest from Forest, Bolton Wanderers and [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]],<ref name="relieved"/> on the same day, Peltier rejoined former club Huddersfield Town on a three-year deal. He took the number 37 shirt which he wore during his loan spell at Nottingham Forest at the end of the previous season. On 7 August, he was named as the new club captain by manager [[Mark Robins]], replacing [[Peter Clarke (footballer)|Peter Clarke]], who left at the end of the previous season.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.examinerlive.co.uk/sport/football/news/lee-peltier-proud-captain-huddersfield-7585819 |title=Lee Peltier so proud to captain Huddersfield Town |publisher=Examiner Live |last=Thomson |first=Doug |date=8 August 2014 |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref> He made his second debut for the Terriers in their 4–0 defeat by AFC Bournemouth on 9 August. However, following the dismissal of Robins, Peltier fell out of favour under new manager [[Chris Powell]] who preferred [[Tommy Smith (footballer, born 1992)|Tommy Smith]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/12040/9673576/transfer-news-cardiff-confirm-signing-of-lee-peltier-from-huddersfield-town |title=Peltier signs for Cardiff |publisher=Sky Sports |date=26 January 2015 |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref> On 16 October, he was relieved of his duties as captain by Powell, being replaced by new signing [[Mark Hudson (footballer, born 1982)|Mark Hudson]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.examinerlive.co.uk/sport/football/news/huddersfield-towns-former-liverpool-leicester-8486435 |title=Huddersfield Town's former Liverpool Leicester and Leeds United defender Lee Peltier "on radar" of Cardiff City |publisher=Examiner Live |last=Booth |first=Mel |date=21 January 2015 |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref> He made only four further appearances under Powell, ending his second spell with Huddersfield having made 12 appearances in all competitions.<ref name=sb1415/>
===Cardiff City=== [[File:Lee Peltier Cardiff City.jpg|thumb|upright|Peltier playing for [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] in 2015]] On 24 January 2015, Peltier signed for [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] on a deal until the summer of 2018,<ref name=cardiffcityfc.co.uk>{{cite web|url=http://www.cardiffcityfc.co.uk/news/article/deal-completed-peltier-is-a-bluebird-2223871.aspx|title=Deal Completed: Peltier Is A Bluebird|first=Mark|last=Denham|publisher=Cardiff City F.C.|date=26 January 2015|accessdate=15 January 2019}}</ref> reuniting with his former Yeovil manager [[Russell Slade]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30907950 |title=Cardiff City: Huddersfield full-back Lee Peltier signs for Bluebirds |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 January 2015 |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref> Signed as a replacement for [[John Brayford]],<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/cardiff-city-sign-ex-liverpool-8511641 |title=Cardiff City sign ex Liverpool FC full back Lee Peltier from Huddersfield Town to replace departing John Brayford |work=WalesOnline |publisher=Media Wales |last=Rogers |first=Gareth |date=24 January 2015 |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref> he made his debut for the club, a week later in a 2–0 loss to [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]],<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30962968 |title=Cardiff City 0–2 Derby County |publisher=BBC Sport |last=Westall |first=Rob |date=31 January 2015 |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref> and went on to help Cardiff push away from a relegation battle and finished mid-table. The following season, Peltier became an ever-present member of the team which had just missed out on a play-off place on the final day against [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Sheffield Wednesday 3–0 Cardiff City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36118083 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 April 2016 |accessdate=30 April 2016}}</ref>
The appointment of [[Paul Trollope]] in 2016 as Slade's successor threatened to displace Peltier from the side with the new manager favouring more attack minded full-back [[Jazz Richards]]. However, Trollope was sacked after three months in charge and was replaced by Peltier's former Leeds manager Neil Warnock.<ref name="unsung">{{cite news|first=Scott|last=Johnson|title=Cardiff City's unsung hero – Why Lee Peltier has rediscovered himself under Neil Warnock|url=https://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/cardiff-citys-unsung-hero-lee-12171473.amp|work=WalesOnline|publisher=Media Wales|accessdate=24 March 2018|date=14 November 2016}}</ref> In February 2017, Peltier underwent an operation on his ankle, which resulted in a long-term absence from the first-team squad. He eventually made his return on 17 April, having missed nearly three months, against Nottingham Forest.<ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City defender Lee Peltier has operation on ankle |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38931420 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 February 2017 |accessdate=10 February 2017}}</ref> Despite an injury-ridden season, he made 28 appearances and was rewarded with a two-year contract extension.<ref>{{cite web|title=Cardiff City: Bluebirds contract extensions for Hoilett and Peltier |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40174267 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 June 2017 |accessdate=6 June 2017}}</ref>
Peltier was part of the side that won promotion to the Premier League during the 2017–18 season, making 30 appearances for the club as they finished as Championship runners-up.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44993945 |title=Lee Peltier: Cardiff City defender discharged after head blow |publisher=BBC Sport |last=Phillips |first=Rob |date=29 July 2018 |accessdate=14 January 2019}}</ref> In the opening match of the following season, he made his Premier League debut in a 2–0 defeat to AFC Bournemouth.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45067370 |title=Bournemouth 2–0 Cardiff |publisher=BBC Sport |last=Pritchard |first=Dafydd |date=11 August 2018 |accessdate=14 January 2019}}</ref> He was dropped from the first team following the match with manager Neil Warnock favouring playing centre-back [[Bruno Ecuele Manga]] at right-back,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/cardiff-city-newcastle-united-bournemouth-15049487 |title=A ruthless Cardiff City selection decision, a surprise stat and the men forced into the shadows |work=WalesOnline |publisher=Media Wales |last=Mitchelmore |first=Ian |date=20 August 2018 |accessdate=14 January 2019}}</ref> not making a league appearance for over a month when he suffered a shoulder injury during a 5–0 defeat to [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on 22 September.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45614525 |title=Cardiff City 0–5 Manchester City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 September 2018 |accessdate=14 January 2019}}</ref>
==International career== Peltier is a former youth international player having represented his native England at international level. He was capped at under-18 level three times during his time as a player at hometown club Liverpool but has not been capped at a higher level than under-18s to date.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thisisleicestershire.co.uk/Huddersfield-pound-1m-price-tag-Leicester-City/story-12789820-detail/story.html|title=Huddersfield put £1m price-tag on Leicester City target Lee Peltier|date=17 June 2011|accessdate=5 May 2013|newspaper=Leicester Mercury |archiveurl=https://archive.is/2nYuc |archivedate=5 May 2013}}</ref>
In 2012, Peltier was approached by the [[Antigua and Barbuda Football Association]] to represent the [[Antigua and Barbuda national football team|Benna Boys]] at international level.<ref>{{cite web|last=Baptitste|first=Neto|title=Help for Benna Boys|url=http://www.antiguaobserver.com/?p=79817|publisher=Antigua Observer|accessdate=8 March 2013|date=22 August 2012}}</ref>
==Style of play== Though mainly a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right-back]], Peltier also plays in the centre-back position.<ref>{{cite news|first=Doug|last=Thomson|title=Huddersfield Town ready to step up bid to bring Lee Peltier back after defender leaves Leeds United|url=https://www.examiner.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/huddersfield-town-ready-step-up-7310804.amp|newspaper=Huddersfield Daily Examiner|accessdate=24 March 2018|date=23 June 2014}}</ref> He has said that right-back is his favourite position and has described himself as "a hard working defensive type of player who likes to tackle and pass the ball. I get about the pitch quite well and keep it simple."<ref name="pink"/><ref>{{cite news|first=Doug|last=Thomson|title=Nothing new about midfield role for Huddersfield Town’s Lee Peltier|url=https://www.examiner.co.uk/sport/football/news/nothing-new-midfield-role-huddersfield-4981184.amp|newspaper=Huddersfield Daily Examiner|accessdate=24 March 2018|date=5 February 2011}}</ref> He does not move up the flanks and shoot crosses; instead he only plays as a defender. Scott Johnson from ''[[Media Wales#Wales Online|WalesOnline]]'' wrote that he "does not fit the modern stereotype of what we now expect from a full-back, as he is not particularly swashbuckling or flashy."<ref name="unsung"/>
==Personal life== In March 2009, Peltier was shopping with fellow footballer [[Victor Anichebe]] in [[Knutsford]] when the pair were stopped by police officers after being accused of theft. During the incident, Peltier was handcuffed by officers and Anichebe's crutch was confiscated. The pair were not arrested over the claim and Anichebe received a public apology from the assistant chief constable of the [[Cheshire Constabulary]] over the claims.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/liverpool-news/cheshire-police-apologises-everton-fc-3457189 |title=Cheshire police apologises to Everton FC star Victor Anichebe over Knutsford incident |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=17 March 2009 |accessdate=11 January 2019}}</ref> Peltier is close friends with fellow footballer [[James Vaughan (footballer, born 1988)|James Vaughan]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.examinerlive.co.uk/sport/football/news/huddersfield-towns-lee-peltier-no-7342880 |title=Huddersfield Town's Lee Peltier has no worries about settling back in |publisher=Examiner Live |last=Thomson |first=Doug |date=30 June 2014 |accessdate=13 January 2019}}</ref>
