{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2011}} {{Infobox football biography | name= Bruno Ecuele Manga | image = FC Lorient - May 24th 2013 training - Bruno Ecuele Manga 2.JPG | image_size = 200 | caption = Manga warming up for [[FC Lorient|Lorient]] in 2013 | fullname = Bruno Ecuele Manga<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.efl.com/documents/professional-retained-report-2015-16549-3151378.pdf |title=EFL: Retained list: 2015/16 |publisher=English Football League |page=17 |format=PDF |accessdate=26 June 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161202052144/http://www.efl.com/documents/professional-retained-report-2015-16549-3151378.pdf |archivedate=2 December 2016 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> | height = {{height|m=1.86|precision=0}} | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1988|7|16}} | birth_place = [[Libreville]], [[Gabon]] | currentclub = [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] | clubnumber = 5 | position = [[Defender (football)|Centre back]] | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = | years1 = 2006 | years2 = 2006–2007 | years3 = 2007–2008 | years4 = 2008 | years5 = 2008–2010 | years6 = 2010–2014 | years7= 2014– | clubs1 = [[FC 105 Libreville]] | clubs2 = [[FC Girondins de Bordeaux|Bordeaux B]] | clubs3 = [[FC Girondins de Bordeaux|Bordeaux]] | clubs4 = → [[Rodez AF|Rodez]] (loan) | clubs5 = [[Angers SCO|Angers]] | clubs6 = [[FC Lorient|Lorient]] | clubs7= [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] | caps1 = | caps2 = 40 | caps3 = 0 | caps4 = 15 | caps5 = 58 | caps6 = 118 | caps7= 141 | goals1 = | goals2 = 0 | goals3 = 0 | goals4 = 0 | goals5 = 5 | goals6 = 4 | goals7 = 5 | pcupdate = 17:04, 9 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalyears1 = 2006– | nationalteam1 = [[Gabon national football team|Gabon]] | nationalcaps1 = 67 | nationalgoals1 = 7 | ntupdate = 1 June 2017 }}
''' Bruno Ecuele Manga ''' (born 16 July 1988) is a Gabonese professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays for Welsh club [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] in the [[Premier League]] and the [[Gabon national football team|Gabon national team]]. Ecuele Manga is known for being a tough tackler.<ref name="Bruno Ecuele Manga Welsh Article">{{cite news|title=Who is Bruno Manga? Everything you need to know about Cardiff City's centre back signing from Lorient|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/who-bruno-manga-everything-you-7696921|publisher=Wales Online|date=31 August 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref>
After beginning his career with [[FC 105 Libreville]] in his home country, joined Frenhh side [[FC Girondins de Bordeaux|Bordeaux]] in 2006. He played for the club's reserve side and spent time on loan with lower division side [[Rodez AF|Rodez]] but only one appearance for the senior side, before being released in 2018. He subsequently joined [[Ligue 2]] side [[Angers SCO|Angers]], making more than 50 appearances in two seasons before joining [[FC Lorient|Lorient]] in 2010 for a fee of €2.5 million.
He made his [[Ligue 1]] debut with Lorient and went on to make more than 100 appearances in the top tier of French football. He was appointed club captain ahead of the [[2012–13 Ligue 1|2012–13 season]] and remained in the role until 2014 when he signed for [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side Cardiff City for €5 million. He spent four seasons in the division before helping the club win promotion to the Premier League after finishing as Championship runners-up in the [[2017–18 Cardiff City F.C. season|2017–18 season]].
Manga made his international debut for Gabon in 2006 and has accumulated 67 caps to date, representing the side at four [[Africa Cup of Nations]] tournaments.
==Club career==
===Early career=== Ecuele Manga began his career in his homeland with [[FC 105 Libreville]], before being recommended to French [[Ligue 1]] side [[Girondins de Bordeaux]] by [[Alain Giresse]] who was manager of the [[Gabon national football team|Gabon national team]].<ref name="union" >{{Cite news |url=https://www.union.sonapresse.com/personnalites-gabonaises/bruno-ecuele-manga-joueur-de-football-14453 |title=Bruno Ecuele-Manga: Joueur de Football |publisher=L'Union |language=French |accessdate=14 February 2019}}</ref> After being involved in the club's preseason fixtures under manager [[Laurent Blanc]],<ref name="union"/> Ecuele Manga made his competitive debut for Bordeaux, making his first start, in the [[2007–08 UEFA Cup group stage#Group H|Matchday Six]], in a 3–2 win over [[Panionios F.C.|Panionios]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Bordeaux fightback flattens Panionios|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2008/matches/round=15119/match=301676/postmatch/report/index.html|publisher=UEFA Official Website|date=20 December 2007|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> However, he never played a league game for the club, and spent time on loan at [[Rodez AF|Rodez]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Foot Transferts Les infos à la mi-journée|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/-/Actualites/-/750000000000000000000000015700|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=31 January 2008|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref>
At the end of his contract, he was signed on a free transfer by [[Angers SCO|Angers]] on a three-year deal, lasting until 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-actu/2008/06/12/01011-20080612FILSPO00097-ecuele-manga-a-angers.php|title=Ecuele Manga à Angers|publisher=Le Figaro|date=12 June 2008|accessdate=6 April 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150406143823/http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-actu/2008/06/12/01011-20080612FILSPO00097-ecuele-manga-a-angers.php|archivedate=6 April 2015|deadurl=no}}</ref> There, Ecuele Manga was joined by two Gabonese compatriots, [[Arsène Do Marcolino]] and [[Fabrice Do Marcolino]]. Ecuele Manga made his Angers' debut in the opening game of the season, in a 0–0 draw against [[SC Bastia|Bastia]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Bastia Vs. Angers 0 – 0|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2008/08/08/france/ligue-2/sporting-club-de-bastia/angers-sporting-club-de-louest/632386/|publisher=Soccerway|date=8 August 2008|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club on 24 October 2008, in a 2–0 win over [[Tours FC|Tours]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Angers Vs. Tours 2 – 0|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2008/10/24/france/ligue-2/angers-sporting-club-de-louest/tours-football-club/632467/|publisher=Soccerway|date=24 October 2008|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> On 3 March 2009, Ecuele Manga signed a new contract with the club, extending his deal until 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Ecuele-manga-prolonge/19469|title=Ecuele Manga prolonge|publisher=L'Equipe|date=5 March 2009|accessdate=6 April 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150406141137/http://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Ecuele-manga-prolonge/19469|archivedate=6 April 2015|deadurl=no}}</ref> This came after a series impressive display at Angers caught attracted attention from several other clubs.<ref>{{cite news|title=English eyes on Manga|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11704/4928637/english-eyes-on-manga|publisher=Sky Sports|date=16 February 2009|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Reds track Gabonese youngster|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11704/5740082/reds-track-gabonese-youngster|publisher=Sky Sports|date=2 December 2009|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> In his first season at Angers, Ecuele Manga made thirty appearances, scoring twice.
Ahead of the 2009–10 season, Ecuele Manga was on the verge of joining [[Stade Rennais F.C.|Rennes]] in a deal worth €4 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Ecuele-manga-proche-de-rennes/47530|title=Foot – Transferts : Ecuélé Manga proche de Rennes|publisher=L'Equipe|date=23 July 2009|accessdate=6 April 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150406141144/http://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Ecuele-manga-proche-de-rennes/47530|archivedate=6 April 2015|deadurl=no}}</ref> However, the move never happened. Ecuele Manga was absent at the start of the season and his first appearance came in a 0–0 draw against [[RC Strasbourg Alsace|Strasbourg]] on 2 October.<ref>{{cite news|title=Angers Vs. Strasbourg 0 – 0|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2009/10/02/france/ligue-2/angers-sporting-club-de-louest/racing-club-de-strasbourg/779314/|publisher=Soccerway|date=2 October 2009|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> In his second game of the season against Strasbourg on 5 March 2010, Ecuele Manga scored the first brace of his career, in a 2–1 win.<ref>{{cite news|title=STRASBOURG VS. ANGERS 1 – 2|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/03/05/france/ligue-2/racing-club-de-strasbourg/angers-sporting-club-de-louest/779494/|publisher=Soccerway|date=5 March 2010|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> In his second season at Angers, Ecuele Manga made twenty-eight appearances, scoring three times. While at Angers, Ecuele Manga became an integral part of their defence set up, establishing himself in the first team. He later explained his departure from Angers.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ecuélé-Manga : "Angers m'a appris que je ne restais pas !"|url=http://www.webgirondins.com/actualite-Arret-de-jeu-Ecuele-Manga--Angers-m-a-appris-que-je-ne-restais-pas-18425.php|publisher=Web Girondins|language=French|date=27 March 2013|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref>
===Lorient=== During the 2010 summer transfer window, he joined [[FC Lorient]] for €2.5 million, and became a first team regular in [[Ligue 1]] as a replacement for [[Laurent Koscielny]] who left Lorient for Arsenal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Koscielny replacement signed|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11704/6250323/koscielny-replacement-signed|publisher=Sky Sports|date=7 July 2010|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Ecuele-manga-a-lorient/120852|title=Ecuele Manga à Lorient|publisher=L'Equipe|date=5 July 2010|accessdate=6 April 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150406142642/http://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Ecuele-manga-a-lorient/120852|archivedate=6 April 2015|deadurl=no}}</ref> Ecuele Manga made his Lorient debut in the opening game of the season, making his first start, in a 2–2 draw against [[AJ Auxerre|Auxerre]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Auxerre Vs. Lorient 2 – 2|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/08/07/france/ligue-1/association-de-la-jeunesse-auxerroise/football-cub-lorient-bretagne-sud/936348/|publisher=Soccerway|date=7 August 2010|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> Ecuele Manga was soon sidelined after injuring his hamstring in training, an injury that caused him to miss two matches in late-November.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ecuele Manga aux soins|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-sport/2010/11/30/97003-20101130FILSPO00528-ecuele-manga-aux-soins.php|publisher=Le Figrano|language=French|date=30 November 2010|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> His season was further disrupted in mid-February when he injured his thigh.<ref>{{cite news|title=Coquelin finalement forfait|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Coquelin-finalement-forfait/177870|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=11 February 2011|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> After making his return in a 3–3 draw against [[AC Arles-Avignon|Arles-Avignon]] on 12 March 2011, Ecuele Manga scored his first Lorient goal, in a 3–1 loss against [[Montpellier HSC|Montpellier]] on 11 May 2011.<ref>{{cite news|title=Montpellier Vs. Lorient 3 – 1|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2011/05/11/france/ligue-1/montpellier-herault-sport-club/football-cub-lorient-bretagne-sud/936691/|publisher=Soccerway|date=11 May 2011|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> In his first season at Lorient, Ecuele Manga scored once in thirty-one appearance for the club.
Ecuele Manga's second season with the club started when he played as center-back in the first-twelve matches (including scoring his first goal of the season against [[Stade Brestois 29|Brest]] on 29 October 2011<ref>{{cite news|title=Match Report: Stade Brestois 29 3 – 1 FC Lorient|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/74480|publisher=Ligue 1|date=29 October 2011|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref>) until he was absent through injury and suspension.<ref>{{cite news|title=Audard et Bourillon incertains|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Audard-et-bourillon-incertains/241132|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=5 November 2011|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Lorient sans E.-Manga, Bourillon|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-sport/2011/11/21/97003-20111121FILSPO00646-lorient-sans-e-manga-bourillon.php|publisher=Le Figrano|language=French|date=21 November 2011|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> While on the sidelines, Ecuele Manga signed a new contract with the club, extending his deal until 2015.<ref>{{cite news|title=Lorient : Ecuele Manga prolonge jusqu'en 2015|url=http://www.mercato365.com/infos-clubs/lorient/lorient-ecuele-manga-prolonge-jusqu-en-2015-769287.shtml|publisher=Mercato 365|language=French|date=23 November 2011|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> He made his return in early-December, in a 4–0 loss against Montpellier.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-sport/2011/11/30/97003-20111130FILSPO00439-cinq-retours-a-lorient.php|title=Cinq retours à Lorient|publisher=Le Figrano|date=30 November 2011|accessdate=6 April 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150406152849/http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-sport/2011/11/30/97003-20111130FILSPO00439-cinq-retours-a-lorient.php|archivedate=6 April 2015|deadurl=no}}</ref> On 17 March 2012, Ecuele Manga scored his second goal of the season, in a 2–1 win over Brest.<ref>{{cite news|title=FC Lorient 2 – 1 Stade Brestois 29|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/74643|publisher=Ligue 1|date=17 March 2012|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> Though scoring twice in thirty-two appearance in his second season, Ecuele Manga's agent announced that Ecuele Manga will stay at the club following a re–ignited interests from clubs around Europe.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ecuele Manga va rester|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-sport/2012/05/21/97003-20120521FILSPO00779-ecuele-manga-va-rester.php|publisher=Le Figrano|language=French|date=21 May 2012|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref>
At the start of the 2012–13 season, Ecuele Manga was appointed as the new captain of Lorient after replacing [[Fabien Audard]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Lorient change de capitaine|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-sport/2012/07/31/97003-20120731FILSPO00384-lorient-change-de-capitaine.php|publisher=Le Figrano|language=French|date=31 July 2013|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> However, in the opening game of the season in a 2–2 draw against [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Zlatan Ibrahimovic helps PSG draw|url=http://espn.go.com/sports/soccer/story/_/id/8260364/zlatan-ibrahimovic-rescues-psg-2-2-draw-lorient|accessdate=15 August 2012|agency=Associated Press}}</ref> Ecuele Manga injured his ligament, and he had to come off, as second half had just started and then it was announced that Ecuele Manga would be out for six months.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ecuele-Manga, c'est 6 mois|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-sport/2012/08/14/97003-20120814FILSPO00472-ecuele-manga-c-est-6-mois.php|publisher=Le Figrano|language=French|date=14 August 2012|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> After a six months absence, he made his return on 26 January 2013, in a 2–1 loss against [[AS Nancy|Nancy]].<ref>{{cite news|title=AS Nancy-Lorraine 2 – 1 FC Lorient|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/76132|publisher=Ligue 1|date=26 January 2013|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Ecuele Manga enfin de retour|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-sport/2013/01/25/97003-20130125FILSPO00697-ecuele-manga-enfin-de-retour.php|publisher=Le Figrano|language=French|date=25 January 2013|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> Ecuele Manga then scored his first goal of the season, in the [[2012–13 Coupe de France#Round of 16|Round of 16 of Coupe de France]], in a 3–0 win over Brest.<ref>{{cite news|title=FC Lorient 3 – 0 Stade Brestois 29|url=http://www.ligue1.com/autresCompetitions/coupeFrance/feuille_match/77448|publisher=Ligue 1|date=27 February 2013|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> Ecuele Manga's captaincy came into question after Lorient lost 5–0 against [[Lille OSC|Lille]] on 7 April 2013.<ref>{{cite news|title=LOSC Lille 5 – 0 Lorient|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/76221|publisher=Ligue 1|date=7 April 2013|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> In response, he reminded himself to take responsibilities as a captain.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ecuele Manga : "Pas le droit"|url=http://sport24.lefigaro.fr/football/ligue-1/Homes-Clubs/lorient/fil-info/ecuele-manga-pas-le-droit-626726|publisher=Le Figrano|language=French|date=12 April 2013|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> With the sideline kept Ecuele Manga for a long time, Ecuele Manga made seventeen appearance and scored once.
In the 2013–14 season, Ecuele Manga continued to remain Lorient captain throughout the season and captained thirty-three matches out of thirty-five appearances he made. Ecuele Manga scored his first goal for the club on 1 March 2014, in a 1–1 draw against Bastia.<ref>{{cite news|title=FC Lorient 1 – 1 SC Bastia|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/feuille_match/77775|publisher=Ligue 1|date=1 March 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> Ecuele Manga was absence for three matches, due to a knee injury occurring in late-February<ref>{{cite news|title=Foot Ligue 1 Lorient Ecuele-Manga ne jouera pas|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Ecuele-manga-ne-jouera-pas/443148|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=20 February 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> and a red card in May, which saw him suspended for one match.<ref name="MangaRedCard">{{cite news|title=3 matches pour Djilobodji|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/3-matches-pour-djilobodji/463152|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=7 May 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> During the season, Ecuele Manga "won 119 aerial duels more than any other player".<ref name="Bruno Ecuele Manga Welsh Article"/>
Having received a red card in his second final game for Lorient, Ecuele Manga was suspended for the opening game of the 2014–15 season for Lorient<ref name="MangaRedCard"/> and after making his return, Ecuele Manga captained once in his three appearance by the end of August. After [[AS Monaco|Monaco]] announced their interest signing Ecuele Manga,<ref>{{cite news|title=Transfert Monaco veut deux Lorientais|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Monaco-veut-deux-lorientais/488871|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=9 August 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> Ecuele Manga hinted leaving Lorient, quoting: ''"I want to see something else, to have other challenges."''<ref>{{cite news|title=Transfert Ecuele Manga (Lorient) : "J'ai envie de voir autre chose"|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Ecuele-manga-voir-autre-chose/493993|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=27 August 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> With a one-year contract left at Lorient, there is slim chance for Ecuele Manga leave at the end of the transfer window.<ref>{{cite news|title=Transfert Lorient pousse pour Amalfitano|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Lorient-pousse-pour-amalfitano/493775|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=27 August 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref>
===Cardiff City=== [[File:Bruno Ecuele Manga 20140916.jpg|thumb|200px|Ecuele Manga playing for [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] in 2014]] On 1 September 2014, Bruno Ecuele Manga signed for Welsh club [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] for €5 million, keeping him until 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cardiffcityfc.co.uk/news/article/manga-cardiff-1891826.aspx|title=DEAL COMPLETED: BRUNO ECUELE MANGA|publisher=Cardiff City F.C.|date=1 September 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150406163059/http://www.cardiffcityfc.co.uk/news/article/manga-cardiff-1891826.aspx|archivedate=6 April 2015|deadurl=no}}</ref>
Ecuele Manga then made his Cardiff City debut, making his first start, in a 1–0 loss against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] on 16 September 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cardiff City 0–1 Middlesbrough|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29120662|publisher=BBC Sport|date=16 September 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> Ecuele Manga scored his first Cardiff City goal, in a 3–1 win over [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] two months later on 1 November 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cardiff City 3–1 Leeds United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29767130|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 November 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> However, Ecuele Manga was on the sideline after injuring his knee during a match against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] and his international commitment<ref>{{cite news|title=Cardiff City: Defender Bruno Ecuele Manga returns to fitness|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30446288|publisher=BBC Sport|date=12 December 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Cardiff City manager Russell Slade reveals Bruno Manga could be putting his place at risk after Gabon qualified for Africa Cup of Nations|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/cardiff-city-manager-russell-slade-8158477|publisher=Wales Online|date=23 November 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> and made his return for his thirteenth start of the season, in a 3–2 loss against [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] on 20 December 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cardiff City 2 – 3 Brentford|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30459342|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 December 2014|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref>
Ecuele Manga was on the sideline again for his international commitment after being included for the Africa Cup of Nations.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cardiffcityfc.co.uk/news/article/team-news-cardiff-vs-derby-2238325.aspx|title=TEAM NEWS – CARDIFF VS DERBY|publisher=Cardiff City F.C.|date=31 January 2015|accessdate=6 April 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150406165254/http://www.cardiffcityfc.co.uk/news/article/team-news-cardiff-vs-derby-2238325.aspx|archivedate=6 April 2015|deadurl=no}}</ref> Ecuele Manga made his return, on 7 February 2015, in a 1–1 draw against [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Sheffield Wednesday 1–1 Cardiff City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31070735|publisher=BBC Sport|date=7 February 2015|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> Ecuele Manga then scored his second goal of the season, in a 3–1 win over [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] on 3 March 2015<ref>{{cite news|title=Rotherham United 1–3 Cardiff City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31597761|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 March 2015|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> and then his third goal came, a week later on 17 March 2015, in a 1–1 draw against [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Cardiff City 1–1 AFC Bournemouth|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31809761|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 March 2015|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref> Ecuele Manga's impressive in his first season led calls for him to be named "Cardiff City's player of the season" by [[Media Wales#WalesOnline|Wales Online]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Bruno Manga is Cardiff City's player of the season and no-one else comes close – Scott Johnson|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/bruno-manga-cardiff-citys-player-8973617|publisher=Wales Online|date=2 April 2015|accessdate=6 April 2015}}</ref>
During the pre-season, Ecuele Manga picked up a knee injury resulting in him missing out on the start of the season.<ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City centre-half Bruno Manga set to return from injury in Capital One Cup clash against AFC Wimbledon |url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/cardiff-city-centre-half-bruno-9800482 |work=South Wales Echo |date=6 August 2015 |accessdate=6 August 2015}}</ref> Making his first appearance in the [[League Cup]] win over [[A.F.C. Wimbledon|AFC Wimbledon]] and then being dropped back to the bench for the league games that followed. Whilst on international duty in September, he picked up a groin injury and was ruled out for two months.<ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City's injured Bruno Ecuele Manga out for two months |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34549550 |work=BBC Sport |date=16 October 2015 |accessdate=16 October 2015}}</ref> Ecuele Manga made his return to the first team coming on as a substitute for the injured, [[Sean Morrison (footballer)|Sean Morrison]] against [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City: Russell Slade slates referee over Birmingham penalty |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/35137843 |work=BBC Sport |date=18 December 2015 |accessdate=18 December 2015}}</ref>
[[File:Bruno Ecuele Manga 20150822.jpg|thumb|right|Manga playing for Cardiff City in 2015.]] Despite another injury ridden season, Ecuele Manga was offered a new contract by manager, [[Neil Warnock]], which was signed on 27 June 2017.<ref>{{cite news |title=Bruno Manga: Neil Warnock casts doubt over defender's Cardiff future |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39603724 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 April 2017 |accessdate=14 April 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City: Defender Bruno Ecuele Manga signs new deal |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40421738 |work=BBC Sport |date=27 June 2017 |accessdate=27 June 2017}}</ref> He made a total of 43 appearances as Cardiff finished 2nd in the league, to earn promotion to the [[Premier League]]. He scored his only goal of the season in a 4–1 over [[Mansfield Town F.C.|Mansfield Town]] in the [[FA Cup]].
Manga scored Cardiff's first goal of 2018–19 season in a 3–1 loss to [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] in the [[Football League Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City 1–3 Norwich City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45254466 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 August 2018 |accessdate=28 August 2018}}</ref>
==International career== {{Expand section|date=April 2015}} Born in [[Libreville]], [[Gabon]], Ecuele Manga was called up by [[Gabon national football team|Gabon]] in 2006. In July 2012, Ecuele Manga represented Gabon at the 2012 Olympic Games held in London. However, they were eliminated in the group stage.

{{good article}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2017}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Jazz Richards | image = Jazz Richards 2016.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Richards playing for [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] in 2016 | fullname = Ashley Darel Jazz Richards<ref>{{cite news|title=Premier League clubs submit squad lists |url=http://www.premierleague.com/page/Headlines/0,,12306~2440123,00.html |publisher=Premier League |date=2 September 2011 |accessdate=3 September 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110923184926/http://www.premierleague.com/page/Headlines/0%2C%2C12306~2440123%2C00.html |archivedate=23 September 2011 |df= }}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1991|4|12|df=y}}<ref name="First Team">{{cite web|url=http://www.swanseacity.net/page/ProfilesDetail/0,,10354~46702,00.html |title=First Team |publisher=Swansea City A.F.C. |accessdate=20 August 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090505052138/http://www.swanseacity.net/page/ProfilesDetail/0%2C%2C10354~46702%2C00.html |archivedate= 5 May 2009 |df= }}</ref> | birth_place = [[Swansea]], Wales | height = {{height|ft=5|in=8}}<ref name="First Team" /> | position = [[Defender (association football)#Full back|Full back]] / [[Midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] | clubnumber = 6 | youthyears1 = | youthyears2 = 2005–2007 | youthyears3 = 2007–2009 | youthclubs1 = [[West End F.C.|West End]] | youthclubs2 = [[Cardiff City F.C. Academy|Cardiff City]] | youthclubs3 = [[Swansea City A.F.C. Under-23s#Swansea City Academy|Swansea City]] | years1 = 2009–2015 | clubs1 = [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] | caps1 = 39 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2013 | clubs2 = → [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] (loan) | caps2 = 11 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2013 | clubs3 = → [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] (loan) | caps3 = 9 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2015 | clubs4 = → [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] (loan) | caps4 = 14 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2015–2016 | clubs5 = [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] | caps5 = 22 | goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2016– | clubs6 = [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] | caps6 = 35 | goals6 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2007–2008 | nationalyears2 = 2008–2009 | nationalyears3 = 2009–2012 | nationalyears4 = 2012– | nationalteam1 = [[Wales national under-17 football team|Wales U17]] | nationalteam2 = [[Wales national under-19 football team|Wales U19]] | nationalteam3 = [[Wales national under-21 football team|Wales U21]] | nationalteam4 = [[Wales national football team|Wales]] | nationalcaps1 = 10 | nationalcaps2 = 11 | nationalcaps3 = 15 | nationalcaps4 = 14 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | club-update = 16:00, 20 October 2018 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 16:00, 20 October 2018 (UTC) }} '''Ashley Darel Jazz Richards''' (born 12 April 1991) is a Welsh professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|full-back]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]].
A versatile player who is also capable of playing at left-back and as a [[midfielder]], Richards began his professional career at his hometown club [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]], having previously played youth football for their local rivals Cardiff City. He made only 51 appearances for the club in all competitions during a six-year spell with the first team.
During his time with the ''Swans'', he spent time on loan with [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], [[Huddersfield Town F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] and [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], before joining the latter for an undisclosed fee in 2015. He established himself in Fulham's first team for a brief period. In 2016, he returned to Cardiff City, helping the club win promotion to the Premier League in 2018.
Richards made his full international debut for [[Wales national football team|Wales]] in 2012, and represented the nation at [[UEFA Euro 2016]]. To date, he has won 14 caps for his country.
==Club career==
===Swansea City=== ====Youth and first–team breakthrough==== [[File:Jazz Richards.jpg|thumb|upright|Richards playing for [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] in 2013]]
Born in [[Swansea]], Richards played local football for his schools and local club [[West End F.C.|West End]],<ref>{{cite web |url=https://youtube.com/watch?v=XSccn3-CkRc|title=The Biggest Keeper In The World vs The Angriest Keeper In The World - West End Vs Caldicot Town|website=YouTube|date=2 May 2018|accessdate=24 January 2019}}</ref> before joining the [[Cardiff City F.C. Academy|Cardiff City Academy]]. After two seasons, he was released and joined the [[Swansea City A.F.C. Under-23s#Swansea City Academy|academy]] at their [[South Wales derby|South Wales]] rivals [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] at the age of fifteen.<ref name="Richards Swansea City">{{cite web|url=http://www.swanseacity.com/news/article/2016-17/ten-years-at-the-liberty-a-comeback-to-be-proud-of-3142840.aspx |title=Ten Years At The Liberty: A comeback to be proud of |publisher=Swansea City A.F.C. |date=28 June 2016 |accessdate=20 September 2016 }}</ref> Richards initially started out as a midfielder but switched to playing as a defender under manager [[Roberto Martínez]] due to the increased competition between midfielders in the first team at the time.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fulham defender insists he is a better midfielder – and so does Everton boss|url=http://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-defender-insists-better-midfielder-10690104|publisher=Get West London|author=Paul Warburton|date=5 January 2016|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref> He has since continued to play at that position as well. Richards earned £60 a week while on a scholarship with the ''Swans''.<ref name="Fivethings">{{cite news|title=Fulham's Jazz Richards: Five things you never knew about the Wales international|url=http://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulhams-jazz-richards-five-things-11119035|publisher=Get West London|author=Paul Warburton|date=31 March 2016|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref>
After spending two seasons with the academy and reserve sides,<ref name="Richards Swansea City"/> Richards made his professional debut for Swansea in a [[EFL Championship|Championship]] match against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] during a 3–0 loss on 15 August 2009, replacing [[Shaun MacDonald]] as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in the 63rd minute.<ref name="Swansea 0 - 3 Middlesbrough">{{cite news | title = Swansea 0–3 Middlesbrough|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/8195062.stm | publisher = BBC Sport|date =15 August 2009| accessdate=20 August 2009}}</ref> After Richards made 15 appearances during the 2009–10 season, he signed a new two-year deal with Swansea.<ref name="Newdeal">{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/s/swansea_city/8704568.stm|title=Ashley Richards signs new Swansea deal|publisher=BBC Sport|date=25 May 2010|accessdate=25 May 2010}}</ref>
The start of the 2010–11 season saw Richards spend the opening six months as an unused substitute or in the reserve side. He did not make his first appearance of the season until 3 January 2011, during a 2–1 defeat against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] following a defensive injury crisis where several first team players were ruled out.<ref name="Leicester">{{cite news|title=Leicester City 2 – 1 Swansea City|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/9331323.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 January 2011|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Eidur Gudjohnsen top of Swansea City wish list|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/eidur-gudjohnsen-top-swans-wish-1855713|publisher=Wales Online|date=3 January 2011|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref> Throughout January and February, Richards was given a handful of first team opportunities. However, he lost his first team place for the remainder of the season following the return of [[Àngel Rangel]] from injury.<ref>{{cite news|title=Rangel warns Swans not to take wounded Rovers lightly|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/rangel-warns-swans-not-take-1853590|publisher=Wales Online|date=18 February 2011|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref> He made eight appearances during the 2010–11 season as Swansea went on to become the first Welsh team ever to gain promotion to the [[Premier League]].<ref name="Soccerway">{{Soccerway|75818|accessdate=22 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/13839037 |title=When Swansea City flew in top flight |publisher=BBC Sport |author=Peter Shuttleworth |accessdate=22 August 2018}}</ref>
After appearing on the bench for several matches at the start of the following season, Richards made his Premier League debut when he came on as a substitute for [[Neil Taylor (footballer)|Neil Taylor]] during a 3–1 loss to [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] on 15 October 2011.<ref>{{cite news|title=Norwich City 3 – 1 Swansea City|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/15226113.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 October 2011|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref> Twelve days later, he was rewarded with a new 18-month contract.<ref name="New Contract">{{cite web | title = Jazz Richards rewarded with new Swansea City contract | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15467773.stm | publisher = BBC Sport | date=27 October 2011 |accessdate =27 November 2011}}</ref> He then made his first start for the club in the Premier League, playing in a 4–2 loss against [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] on 3 December 2011.<ref>{{cite news|title=Blackburn Rovers 4 – 2 Swansea City|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/15901858.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 December 2011|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref> As the 2011–12 season progressed, Richards was sent to play in the reserves for the rest of the season, in order to regain his fitness.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/jazz-richards-future-liberty-says-2513998 |title=Jazz Richards has future at Liberty, says Michael Laudrup |publisher=WalesOnline |date=29 March 2013 |accessdate=27 August 2018}}</ref> He finished the season with eight appearances.<ref name="Soccerway"/>
====Loan to Crystal Palace in 2013==== At the start of the 2012–13 season, Richards struggled to break into the first team over Rangel in the right-back position.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/swansea-city-full-back-jazz-richards-5890028 |title=Swansea City full-back Jazz Richards joins Huddersfield on loan |publisher=WalesOnline |author=Jon Doel |date=10 September 2013 |accessdate=27 August 2018}}</ref> Because of this, he stated his desire to leave the club on loan to gain experience and compete for his spot in the first team.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://amp.sportsmole.co.uk/football/swansea-city/news/richards-hopes-to-impress-laudrup_92450.html |title=Jazz Richards hopes to impress Michael Laudrup |publisher=Sports Mole |author=Sian Cowper |date=7 July 2013 |accessdate=27 August 2018}}</ref> However, he was forced to wait until the winter transfer window to secure a move. In the first half of the season, he made just four appearances for Swansea, all in cup competitions. At the end of January, he joined [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] on loan until the end of the season.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21202706|title=Crystal Palace sign Swansea's Ashley Richards on loan|publisher=BBC Sport|date=25 January 2013|accessdate=25 January 2013}}</ref> He made his debut for the club five days later, on 30 January 2013 in a 1–0 loss against Huddersfield Town.<ref>{{cite news|title=Hudderfield Town 0 – 1 Crystal Palace|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21156106|publisher=BBC Sport|date=30 January 2013|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref> In his next match, against [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]], Richards assisted [[Glenn Murray]]'s winning goal, as Palace defeated their [[South London derby|South London rivals]] 2–1.<ref>{{cite news|title=Glenn Murray scored late double as Crystal Palace beat Charlton 2–1|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/262499/report|publisher=Sky Sports|date=2 February 2013|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref> During his loan spell, he signed a new contract with Swansea until June 2016.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21964725|title=Jazz Richards signs new three-year Swansea City contract|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 March 2013|accessdate=28 March 2013}}</ref> He went on to make 11 appearances and appeared as an unused substitute in the [[2013 Football League Championship play-off Final|2013 Championship play-off final]], as Palace beat [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] 1–0 to achieve promotion to the Premier League.<ref name="Soccerway"/>
====Loan to Huddersfield Town==== After returning to Swansea, Richards made his first appearance of the 2013–14 season in the second leg of the [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] qualifiers, a 0–0 draw against [[Malmö FF|Malmö]], helping Swansea advance 4–0 on aggregate.<ref>{{cite news|title=Malmo 0 – 0 Swansea City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23527524|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 August 2013|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref> On 10 September 2013, Richards joined Championship side Huddersfield Town on a 93-day emergency loan.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/24037401 |title=Huddersfield Town sign Swansea City's Jazz Richards |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 September 2013 |accessdate=28 October 2018}}</ref> After not being able to obtain international clearance from [[FIFA]] in time to play against [[Doncaster Rovers F.C.|Doncaster Rovers]] on 14 September,<ref>{{cite news|title=Swansea City loan man Jazz Richards furious at FIFA paperwork snag as Huddersfield Town boss Robins admits: 'We are in the lap of the Gods'|url=http://www.examiner.co.uk/sport/football/news/swansea-city-loan-man-jazz-6029249|publisher=The Huddersfield Examiner|author=Mel Booth|date=16 September 2013|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref> he made his Town debut as a substitute in a 2–1 win over Charlton Athletic on 17 September 2013.<ref>{{cite news|title=Huddersfield Town 2 Charlton Athletic 1: Examiner match report|url=http://www.examiner.co.uk/sport/football/match-reports/huddersfield-town-2-charlton-athletic-6056053|publisher=The Huddersfield Examiner|author=Doug Thomson|date=19 September 2013|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref> His loan spell ended on 17 December after just 9 appearances for the Terriers.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.htafc.com/news/article/first-team-news-jazz-returns-to-swansea-1241171.aspx |title=Jazz Returns To Swansea City |publisher=Huddersfield Town A.F.C. |date=17 December 2013 |accessdate=20 September 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160920152325/http://www.htafc.com/news/article/first-team-news-jazz-returns-to-swansea-1241171.aspx |archivedate=20 September 2016 |deadurl=no |df= }}</ref> Following his return from his loan spell, Richards did not appear in another match until 16 February 2014 when he made played in a 3–1 loss against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] in the last-sixteen of the FA Cup.<ref>{{cite news|title=Everton 3 – 1 Swansea City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26105962|publisher=BBC Sport|date=16 February 2014|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref> He made no further appearances during the remainder of the season.<ref name="Soccerway"/>
====Return to Swansea==== In the 2014–15 season, Richards made his first appearance of the season in the first round of the League Cup, in a 1–0 win over [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] on 26 August 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=Swansea City 1 – 0 Rotherham United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28847204|publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 August 2014|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref> He then made his first Premier League appearance in two years when he came on as a substitute in the 82nd minute of a 0–0 draw against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] on 27 September 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=Sunderland 0 – 0 Swansea City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29289979|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 September 2014|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref> Following this, Richards was given a handful of first team appearances throughout 2014 despite struggling to compete with Rangel and suffering his own injury concerns.<ref>{{cite news|title=Stoke City vs Swansea City: Everything you need to know about Sunday's Premier League clash|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/stoke-city-vs-swansea-city-7954784|publisher=WalesOnline|author=Chris Wathan|date=17 October 2014|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/swansea-city-full-back-jazz-richards-9426554 |title=Swansea City full-back Jazz Richards set for Fulham move after £500,000 fee agreed |publisher=WalesOnline |author=Chris Wathan |date=10 June 2015 |accessdate=27 August 2018}}</ref> In a 2–1 loss against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] on 14 December 2014, Richards made an error that led to [[Christian Eriksen]] scoring the winning goal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Swansea City 1 – 2 Tottenham Hotspur|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30366054|publisher=BBC Sport|date=14 December 2014|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref> After the match, he issued an apology to Swansea City supporters for his error.<ref name="abuse">{{cite web |url=https://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/swansea-citys-jazz-richards-took-8333303 |title=Swansea City's Jazz Richards: I took Twitter flak from Swans fans for Tottenham Hotspur mistake |publisher=WalesOnline |author=Simon Gaskell |date=23 December 2014 |accessdate=27 August 2018}}</ref> Despite his apology, he became a victim of abuse on social media website Twitter by Swansea City supporters.<ref name="abuse"/> Manager [[Garry Monk]] backed Richards and picked him in the club's following fixture against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]].<ref name="abuse"/>
This turned out to be Richards' last season with Swansea. In six years, he made just 51 appearances for the club and never established himself as a regular. Only 18 of his appearances coming in the Premier League. His lone match in the 2013–14 Europa League qualifiers was his only appearance in a European competition for the club.<ref name="sb"/>
===Fulham=== On 24 January 2015, Richards joined Championship side [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] on a one-month loan deal.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Jazz joins Fulham on loan |url=http://www.swanseacity.com/news/article/jazz-joins-fulham-on-loan-2222919.aspx |publisher=Swansea City A.F.C. |date=24 January 2015 |accessdate=27 August 2018 }}</ref> He made his debut for the club on 31 January 2015, starting in a 2–1 loss against [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Sky Bet Championship: Blackburn Rovers battle to 2–1 victory over Fulham at Ewood Park|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/blackburn-vs-fulham/report/314092|publisher=Sky Sports|date=1 February 2015|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref> After making five appearances, Richards had his loan spell with Fulham extended until the end of the season.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Jazz extends Fulham loan for remainder of season |url=http://www.swanseacity.com/news/article/jazz-extends-fulham-loan-for-remainder-of-season-2296118.aspx |publisher=Swansea City A.F.C |date=25 February 2015 |accessdate=27 August 2018 }}</ref> Richards went on to make 14 appearances for the Cottagers, all of which were starts.<ref name="Soccerway"/>
On 2 July 2015, Swansea accepted Fulham's bid for Richards to transfer on a permanent deal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fulham transfer news: Swansea accept bid for Jazz Richards |url=http://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/fulham-transfer-news-swansea-accept-9425260|publisher=Get West London|author=Matt Lewis|date=10 June 2015|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref> He signed a three-year deal with the option of a fourth, for an undisclosed fee.<ref>{{cite web|title=Jazz Joins Fulham |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2015/july/02/jazz-joins-fulham |publisher=Fulham F.C. |accessdate=2 July 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150702195809/http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2015/july/02/jazz-joins-fulham |archivedate= 2 July 2015 |deadurl=no |df= }}</ref> Although his year was marked with injuries,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2015/september/24/team-news |title=Team News |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=24 September 2015 |accessdate=20 September 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150925122917/http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2015/september/24/team-news |archivedate=25 September 2015 |deadurl=no |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2015/october/29/team-news |title=Team News |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=29 October 2015 |accessdate=20 September 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151030095746/http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2015/october/29/team-news |archivedate=30 October 2015 |deadurl=no |df= }}</ref> Richards' made 22 appearances in his only season as a permanent player at the club. He established himself as a regular when he was fit. However, ahead of the 2016–17 season, Richards was expected to lose his first team place at Fulham, with manager [[Slaviša Jokanović]] preferring [[Ryan Fredericks]] in the right-back position.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fulham boss insists there is a future for Wales international and ex-Swansea Jazz Richards – but it's not where you think|url=http://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-boss-insists-future-wales-10971823|publisher=Get West London|author=Paul Warburton|date=1 March 2016|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref> As a result, Fulham accepted a bid from Cardiff City for Richards.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ex-Swansea City defender Jazz Richards could become first Welsh signing of Paul Trollope's Cardiff City tenure|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ex-swansea-city-defender-jazz-11607313|publisher=WalesOnline|author=Phil Smith|date=13 July 2016|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref>
===Cardiff City=== On 19 July 2016, Richards joined Championship club Cardiff City on a three-year-deal in a swap move which saw [[Scott Malone]] join Fulham.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cardiff sign Wales defender Jazz Richards as Scott Malone moves to Fulham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36780146|accessdate=19 July 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=19 July 2016}}</ref> He made his debut in a goalless draw at [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]], where he became embroiled in controversy after reportedly refusing to do Cardiff's traditional [[ayatollah]] gesture, performed by fans of the club, several times at the match.<ref>{{cite news |title=Why Cardiff City fans booed former Swansea City star Jazz Richards – the full inside story of what happened |url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/cardiff-city-fans-booed-former-11715863 |publisher=WalesOnline |author=Paul Abbandonato |date=7 August 2016 |accessdate=7 August 2016}}</ref> However, the club later released video footage that showed him performing the gesture.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/cardiff-city-star-jazz-richards-11728968 |title=Cardiff City star Jazz Richards insists he DID do the Ayatollah as boss Paul Trollope holds talks with former Swansea City defender |publisher=WalesOnline |author=Chris Wathan |date=10 August 2016 |accessdate=22 August 2018}}</ref>
After starting the season as a regular in the first team, Richards suffered a training injury in September that led to him missing three months of the season. His lengthy rehabilitation prompted manager [[Neil Warnock]] to quip "I've had lads with broken legs recover quicker than him." He eventually made his return on 2 January, as unused substitute against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff boss Warnock disappointed at speed of Richards return |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38410649 |publisher=BBC Sport |author=Michael Pearlman |date=22 December 2016 |accessdate=22 December 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City 1–0 Aston Villa |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38433120 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 January 2017 |accessdate=2 January 2017}}</ref> He enjoyed an extended run in the first team soon after, playing in ten of the club's following twelve matches, stating that he felt that he had "a lot more to show. I think I'm nowhere near my full potential."<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39204698 |title=Jazz Richards: Wales defender 'back in the game' at Cardiff City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 March 2017 |accessdate=22 August 2018}}</ref> In his first season with Cardiff, he appeared in a career high 26 league matches.<ref name="sb"/>
At the start of the following season, Richards again suffered an injury blow early in the season, being forced to undergo surgery after hurting his ankle during 2–1 victory over Sunderland on 23 September 2017.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41408903 |title=Jazz Richards ankle injury blow for Wales and Cardiff City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 September 2017 |accessdate=22 August 2018}}</ref> He returned from injury in January 2018, playing in five matches before his season was ended by a further injury.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.insidewalessport.co.uk/cardiff-city-short-right-back/ |title=Are Cardiff City leaving themselves short in the right-back position? Why Warnock should be looking to add depth ahead of Premier League start |publisher=Inside Wales Sport |author=Jamie Kemble |date=8 August 2018 |accessdate=28 October 2018}}</ref> He made only eleven appearances in all competitions during the season as Cardiff achieved promotion after finishing as runners-up.<ref name="Soccerway"/>
==International career== Richards represented the [[Wales national under-17 football team|Wales under-17]] and [[Wales national under-19 football team|under-19]] sides.<ref name="First Team" /> He was called up to the [[Wales national under-21 football team|under-21]] squad for the first time in March 2009 to face [[Luxembourg national under-21 football team|Luxembourg]]. He won ten or more caps at all three levels during his youth career.<ref name="First Team" />
On 27 May 2012, he gained his first full international cap for Wales in their 2–0 friendly loss to [[Mexico national football team|Mexico]] in [[New Jersey]], replacing Neil Taylor for the last ten minutes of the match.<ref>{{cite news|title=Friendly international: Mexico 2–0 Wales|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/18230970|accessdate=26 June 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 May 2012}}</ref> Wales qualified for [[UEFA Euro 2016|Euro 2016]] and Richards was called up into the final 23-man squad.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36414580 |title=Euro 2016: Wales include Joe Ledley in 23-man squad for Euro 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 May 2016 |accessdate=27 August 2018}}</ref> He played his only game in the tournament as a late substitute in the team's first match, a 2–1 victory over [[Slovakia national football team|Slovakia]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36450646 |title=Wales 2–1 Slovakia |publisher=BBC Sport |author=Dafydd Pritchard |date=11 June 2016 |accessdate=28 October 2018}}</ref> Wales went on to reach the semi-finals before losing to [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36728931 |title=Euro 2016: Wales lose semi-final but are still winners |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 July 2016 |accessdate=27 August 2018}}</ref> As of October 2018, Richards has had 14 international caps with Wales, including seven appearances in the starting lineup. He played in four matches in Euro 2016 qualifying and three in 2018 World Cup qualifying.<ref name="nft">{{NFT player|47724|accessdate=28 October 2018}}</ref>
==Career statistics==
===Club=== {{updated|20 October 2018}}<ref name="sb">{{Soccerbase|id=51700|accessdate=27 August 2018}}</ref>

Apps || Goals |- ! colspan=3 | England ! colspan=2 | League ! colspan=2 | [[FA Cup]] ! colspan=2 | [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] ! colspan=2 | [[UEFA|Europe]] ! colspan=2 | Total |- |rowspan=7|[[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]]||[[2009–10 Football League Championship|2009–10]]||rowspan=2|[[EFL Championship|Championship]]||15||0||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||15||0 |- |[[2010–11 Football League Championship|2010–11]]||6||0||1||0||1||0||colspan=2|—||8||0 |- |[[2011–12 Premier League|2011–12]]||rowspan=4|[[Premier League]]||8||0||1||0||0||0||colspan=2|—||9||0 |- |[[2012–13 Premier League|2012–13]]||0||0||1||0||3||0||colspan=2|—||4||0 |- |[[2013–14 Premier League|2013–14]]||0||0||1||0||0||0||1||0||2||0 |- |[[2014–15 Premier League|2014–15]]||10||0||1||0||2||0||colspan=2|—||13||0 |- !colspan=2|Total !39||0||5||0||6||0||1||0||51||0 |- |[[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] (loan) |[[2012–13 Football League Championship|2012–13]] |rowspan=4|Championship |11||0||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||11||0 |- |[[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] (loan) |[[2013–14 Football League Championship|2013–14]] |9||0||colspan=2|—||0||0||colspan=2|—||9||0 |- |[[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] (loan) |[[2014–15 Football League Championship|2014–15]] |14||0||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||14||0 |- |- |rowspan=2|[[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] |[[2015–16 Football League Championship|2015–16]] |22||0||1||0||3||0||colspan=2|—||26||0 |- !colspan=2|Total !36||0||1||0||3||0||0||0||40||0 |- |rowspan=4|[[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] |[[2016–17 EFL Championship|2016–17]] |rowspan=2|Championship |26||0||1||0||1||0||0||0||28||0 |- |[[2017–18 Cardiff City F.C. season|2017–18]] |6||0||3||0||2||0||0||0||11||0 |- |[[2018–19 Cardiff City F.C. season|2018–19]] |Premier League |3||0||0||0||1||0||0||0||4||0 |- !colspan=2|Total !35||0||4||0||4||0!!0!!0!!43!!0 |- !colspan=3|Career total !130!!0!!10!!0!!13!!0!!1!!0!!154!!0 |}

{| class=wikitable style=text-align:center !colspan="3"|[[Wales national football team|Wales national team]] |- !Year!!Apps!!Goals |- | 2012 || 1 || 0 |- | 2013 || 3 || 0 |- | 2015 || 4 || 0 |- | 2016 || 2 || 0 |- | 2017 || 3 || 0 |- | 2018 || 1 || 0 |- ! Total || 14 || 0 |}
==Personal life== Richards' comes from a family with a sporting background as his cousins [[Eli Walker]] and Tobias Webb are also professional athletes. Walker is a rugby union player while Webb is a super-middleweight champion boxer.<ref>{{cite news|title=Huddersfield Town's Swansea City loanee Jazz Richards is a 'real footballing right-back' says journalist who's watched his career|url=http://www.examiner.co.uk/sport/football/news/huddersfield-towns-swansea-city-loanee-5908829|publisher=The Huddersfield Examiner|author=Mel Booth|date=11 September 2013|accessdate=20 September 2016}}</ref>
