{{Use British English|date=December 2011}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Gary Madine | image = Madine, Gary.jpg | image_size = | caption = Madine following a match for [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] in 2018 | fullname = Gary Lee Madine{{cite web |url=https://www.efl.com/siteassets/efl-documents/efl-professional-retain-list--free-transfers---2017-18.pdf |title=Club list of registered players: As at 19th May 2018: Cardiff City |publisher=English Football League |format=PDF |page=12 |accessdate=17 June 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1990|8|24|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Gateshead]], England | height = {{convert|1.93|m|order=flip}}{{cite web |url=https://www.cardiffcityfc.co.uk/teams/first-team/forward/gary-madine/ |title=Gary Madine |publisher=Cardiff City F.C. |accessdate=18 December 2018}} | position = [[Forward (association football)#Striker|Striker]] | currentclub = [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]]
(on loan from [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]]) | clubnumber = 14 | youthyears1 = 2004–2007 | youthclubs1 = [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]] | years1 = 2007–2011 | years2 = 2009 | years3 = 2009 | years4 = 2010 | years5 = 2011–2015 | years6 = 2014 | years7 = 2014–2015 | years8 = 2015 | years9 = 2015–2018 | years10 = 2018– | years11 = 2019– | clubs1 = [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]] | clubs2 = → [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]] (loan) | clubs3 = → [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] (loan) | clubs4 = → [[Chesterfield F.C.|Chesterfield]] (loan) | clubs5 = [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] | clubs6 = → [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]] (loan) | clubs7 = → [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] (loan) | clubs8 = → [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] (loan) | clubs9 = [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] | clubs10 = [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] | clubs11 = → [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] (loan) | caps1 = 67 | caps2 = 3 | caps3 = 9 | caps4 = 4 | caps5 = 101 | caps6 = 5 | caps7 = 11 | caps8 = 15 | caps9 = 96 | caps10 = 18 | caps11 = 10 | goals1 = 14 | goals2 = 0 | goals3 = 0 | goals4 = 0 | goals5 = 26 | goals6 = 2 | goals7 = 3 | goals8 = 2 | goals9 = 24 | goals10 = 0 | goals11 = 2 | club-update = 21:47, 12 March 2019 (UTC) }} '''Gary Lee Madine''' (born 24 August 1990) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|striker]] on loan at [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] from [[Premier League]] side [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]]. Madine began his career with [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]], where he made his first team debut in 2007. He was sent out on loan in 2009, first with [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]] and then [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] before joining [[Chesterfield F.C.|Chesterfield]] in 2010 on loan. He signed a permanent contract with [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] in January 2011 for an undisclosed fee. ==Early life== Madine was born in [[Gateshead]], Tyne and Wear.{{Hugman|23990|accessdate=17 June 2018}} He attended local secondary school [[Lord Lawson of Beamish Community School|Lord Lawson of Beamish Comprehensive School]] from 2001–2006. He was originally on the books of [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]], however he was released and joined [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle]]. [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] players [[Alan Shearer]] and [[Chris Waddle]] were his heroes growing up.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/15310862 "Sheffield Wednesday's Gary Madine wins Football League Award"] BBC Sport. 14 October 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. ==Career== ===Carlisle United=== He progressed through the youth ranks of Carlisle, making his debut at the age of 17 on 3 March 2008, in a 1–0 away win against [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]], coming on as a substitute for [[Danny Graham (footballer)|Danny Graham]] in the 92nd minute.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~37198,00.html "Nottingham Forest 0–1 Carlisle"] Carlisle United F.C. 3 March 2008. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He went on to make 12 appearances that season, before signing a new three-year contract in June 2008.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/carlisle_united/7437713.stm "Madine awarded new Carlisle deal"] 5 June 2008. Retrieved 2 April 2012. His first appearances of the following season came in the [[Football League Cup|League Cup]], a 1–0 win away to [[Football League Two|League Two]] side [[Shrewsbury Town F.C.|Shrewsbury Town]] and a 4–0 defeat to [[Football League Championship|Championship]] side [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]].[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~46440,00.html "Shrewsbury 0–1 Carlisle"] Carlisle United F.C. 12 August 2008. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~46519,00.html "QPR 4–0 Carlisle"] Carlisle United F.C. 26 August 2008. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored his first goal for the club in a 4–1 win in the league against Yeovil Town on 30 August 2008.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~43652,00.html "Carlisle 4–1 Yeovil"] Carlisle United F.C. 30 August 2008. Retrieved 2 April 2012. His next goal came on 7 October in the [[Football League Trophy]], making the score 2–2 after [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]] had taken a 2-goal lead. The game went to penalties and Madine scored his however Carlisle lost the shoot-out 4–3.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~46564,00.html "Rochdale 2–2 Carlisle"] 7 October 2008. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored on his [[FA Cup]] debut as Carlisle drew 1–1 to [[Grays Athletic F.C.|Grays Athletic]] at [[Brunton Park]] on 8 November.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~46679,00.html "Carlisle 1–1 Grays Athletic"] Carlisle United F.C. 8 November 2008. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He played in the replay which Carlisle won 2–0, however Carlisle were eliminated in the next round by [[Crewe Alexandra F.C.|Crewe]].[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~46735,00.html "Grays Athletic 0–2 Carlisle"] 29 November 2008. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~46822,00.html "Carlisle 0–2 Crewe"] Carlisle United F.C. 3 December 2008. Retrieved 2 April 2012. On 20 March 2009, Madine signed on a month-long loan for [[Football League Two|League Two]] team [[Rochdale A.F.C|Rochdale]].[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/r/rochdale/7954646.stm "Madine leaves Cumbrians for Dale"] BBC Sport. 20 March 2009. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He made his debut the next day, setting up [[Adam le Fondre]] to score a last-minute winner as Rochdale beat [[Wycombe Wanderers F.C.|Wycombe]] 1–0.[http://www.rochdaleafc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10441~44985,00.html "Wycombe 0–1 Rochdale"] Rochdale A.F.C. 21 March 2009. Retrieved 2 April 2009. He made a further two appearances before returning to Carlisle.[http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=46584&season_id=138 "Gary Madine Football Stats Season 2008/2009"] Soccerbase. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored his first goal of the following season in a 2–0 League Cup win over Championship side [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]], helping Carlisle into the third round of the League Cup for the first time since 1976.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~50698,00.html "Bristol City 0–2 Carlisle"] Carlisle United F.C. 26 August 2009. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He made regular appearances before joining Championship side [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] on a three-month loan on 19 October 2009.[http://www.ccfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10269~1830879,00.html "Madine joins on loan"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091022062354/http://www.ccfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10269~1830879%2C00.html |date=22 October 2009 }} Coventry City F.C. 19 October 2009. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He made his debut on 24 October in a 0–0 draw against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Brom]] at the [[Ricoh Arena]].[http://www.ccfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10269~48291,00.html "Coventry 0–0 West Brom"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091027044205/http://www.ccfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0%2C%2C10269~48291%2C00.html |date=27 October 2009 }} Coventry City F.C. 24 October 2009. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He made 9 appearances before returning to Carlisle on 20 January 2010.[http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=46584&season_id=139 "Gary Madine Football Stats Season 2009/2010"] Soccerbase. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He made 4 appearances including a Football League Trophy Northern Area Final win on penalties against [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]], scoring his penalty in the shoot-out.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~51248,00.html "Carlisle 2–3 Leeds"] Carlisle United F.C. 9 February 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He then joined League Two side [[Chesterfield F.C.|Chesterfield]] on a month-long loan deal on 12 February.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/chesterfield/8513106.stm "Chesterfield sign striker Gary Madine from Carlisle"] BBC Sport. 12 February 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He made 4 appearances before returning to Carlisle.[http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=46584&season_id=139 "Gary Madine Football Stats Season 2009/2010"] Soccerbase. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He played and scored in the [[2010 Football League Trophy Final|Football League Trophy Final]] on 28 March 2010 at [[Wembley Stadium|Wembley]], scoring a consolation goal as Carlisle lost the game 4–1 to [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]].[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~51345,00.html "Carlisle 1–4 Southampton"] Carlisle United F.C. 28 March 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He began to find form and scored 4 goals in the last six matches of the season, with the goals coming against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton]], [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham]], Southampton, and in a 2–0 win against league winners [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich]] on the final day of the season.[http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=46584&season_id=139 "Gary Madine Football Stats Season 2009/2010"] Soccerbase. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored on the opening day of the 2010–11 season, in a 2–0 home win against [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]].[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~52637,00.html "Carlisle 2–0 Brentford"] Carisle United F.C. 7 August 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012. His next goal came in a 4–1 win against [[MK Dons]] on 21 August.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~52729,00.html "Carlisle 4–1 MK Dons"] 21 August 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012. On 28 September, he scored a hat-trick in a 4–0 away win against rivals [[Hartlepool United F.C.|Hartlepool United]].[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~51485,00.html "Hartlepool 0–4 Carlisle"] Carlisle United F.C. 28 September 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012. After goals against [[Notts County F.C.|Notts County]] and [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton]], he scored 4 goals in a 6–0 FA Cup win against [[Tipton Town F.C.|Tipton Town]].[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~51552,00.html "Carlisle 1–0 Notts County"] Carlisle United F.C. 9 October 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~51656,00.html "Carlisle 3–4 Charlton"] Carlisle United F.C. 23 October 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~54818,00.html "Carlisle 6–0 Tipton"] Carlisle United F.C. 6 November 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012. In November, he scored in back-to-back games against Rochdale and [[Tamworth F.C.|Tamworth]].[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~52941,00.html "Carlisle 1–1 Rochdale"] 23 November 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~54851,00.html "Carlisle 3–2 Tamworth"] 27 November 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He played his final game for Carlisle on 8 January 2011 in a 1–0 away defeat to [[Torquay United F.C.|Torquay United]] in the FA Cup.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~54940,00.html "Torquay 1–0 Carlisle"] 8 January 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He finished his Carlisle career with 83 appearances and 22 goals.[http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=46584&season_id=141 "Gary Madine Football Stats"] Soccerbase. Retrieved 2 April 2012. ===Sheffield Wednesday=== On 15 January 2011, Madine signed for [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]], signing a four and a half year contract.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/s/sheff_wed/9362871.stm "Sheffield Wednesday sign Gary Madine & Mark Reynolds"] 16 January 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He made his debut on 22 January in a 4–0 away loss to [[Leyton Orient F.C.|Leyton Orient]].[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/9362036.stm "Leyton Orient 4–0 Sheff Wed"] BBC Sport. 22 January 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored on his second appearance 3 days later, in a 2–2 draw against [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]] at [[Hillsborough Stadium|Hillsborough]].[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/9369744.stm "Sheff Wed 2–2 Yeovil"] BBC Sport. 25 January 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored again the following game in a 5–3 defeat to [[Peterborough United F.C.|Peterborough]] at [[London Road Stadium|London Road]].[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/9377243.stm "Peterborough 5–3 Sheff Wed"] BBC Sport. 1 February 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. His next goal came in a 4–0 win against [[Tranmere Rovers F.C.|Tranmere]], and his final goal of the season came in a 2–0 win against Preston North End.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/12930639 "Sheff Wed 4–0 Tranmere"] 5 April 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17497480"] BBC Sport. 16 April 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He finished the season with 18 goals in all competitions for both Carlisle and Sheffield Wednesday.[http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=46584&season_id=140 "Gary Madine Football Stats Season 2010/2011"] Soccerbase. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored his first goal of the 2011–12 season in a 2–1 win against Notts County on 20 August 2011.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14514729 "Sheffield Wed 2–1 Notts County"] BBC Sport. 20 August 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. On 27 August he scored a brace as Sheffield Wednesday beat [[Scunthorpe United F.C.|Scunthorpe United]] 3–2.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14600461 "Sheffield Wed 3–2 Scunthorpe"] BBC Sport. 27 August 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. On 10 September he scored a brace in a 3–1 win against MK Dons,[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14773295 "Sheffield Wed 3–1 MK Dons"] BBC Sport. 10 September 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. and went on a 4-game goal-scoring run, scoring goals against [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]] and Yeovil, and a brace against [[Exeter City F.C.|Exeter]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14799570 "Stevenage 5–1 Sheffield Wed"] BBC Sport. 13 September 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14864001 "Yeovil 2–3 Sheffield Wed"] BBC Sport. 17 September 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14958283 "Sheffield Wed 3–0 Exeter"] BBC Sport. 24 September 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored his 10th goal of the season in a 3–1 win against Chesterfield.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/15135163 "Sheffield Wed 3–1 Chesterfield"] BBC Sport. 8 October 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored in the following game, this time in a 2–2 draw against city rivals [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]]. The game is known as the [[Steel City derby]], and after being two goals down, Wednesday scored two goals in the last 10 minutes including Madine's 85th-minute header to make the score 2–2. This was his first Sheffield derby.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/15231221 "Sheffield United 2–2 Sheffield Wed"] BBC Sport. 16 October 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He was named Football League Young Player of the Month for September, after scoring 10 goals in 12 games.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/15310862 "Sheffield Wednesday's Gary Madine wins Football League Award"] BBC Sport. 14 October 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[http://www.football-league.co.uk/league1/news/20111014/madine-named-young-player-of-the-month_2293324_2481770 "Madine named Young Player of the Month"] The Football League. 14 October 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. On 25 October he was sent off for the first time in his career, in a 3–2 loss at former club Carlisle.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/15346259 "Carlisle 3–2 Sheffield Wed"] BBC Sport. 25 October 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He broke his toe during a 2–1 win against Tranmere on 19 November and was out for six weeks.[http://www.sheffieldtelegraph.co.uk/news/madine-warning-injury-break-s-not-a-holiday-1-3998455 "Madine warning: 'Injury break not a holiday'"] Sheffield Telegraph. 24 November 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He bounced back from his injury by scoring in his second game back during a 2–2 draw against Hartlepool.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/16559597 "Sheffield Wed 2–2 Hartlepool"] BBC Sport. 21 January 2012. Retrieved 2 April 2012. On 6 March 2012, he scored in a 4–1 win against [[Bury F.C.|Bury]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17187826 "Sheffield Wed 4–1 Bury"] BBC Sport. 6 March 2012. Retrieved 2 April 2012. Later that month he scored in back to back games in a 2–1 win against [[Notts County F.C.|Notts County]] and an injury time equaliser in 2–2 draw against [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17323704 "Notts County 1–2 Sheffield Wed"] BBC Sport. 17 March 2012. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17349082 "Sheffield Wed 2–2 Walsall"] BBC Sport. 20 March 2012. Retrieved 2 April 2012. On 31 March he scored two goals as Sheffield Wednesday beat [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston]] 2–0 at home.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17497480 "Sheffield Wed 2–0 Preston"] BBC Sport. 31 March 2012. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored his first league goal of the 2012–13 season on 9 November, in a 3–1 defeat away to [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20177121 "Middlesbrough 3–1 Sheff Wed"] BBC Sport. 9 November 2012. Retrieved 9 November 2012. On 27 March 2014, Madine re-joined his former club [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]] on loan until the end of the [[2013–14 Football League One|2013–14]] season.{{Cite web |title=LOAN: Striker makes a return |url=http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/news/article/madineloan27mar14-1446851.aspx |work=Carlisle United FC |date=27 March 2014}} ====Coventry City (loan)==== Madine re-joined [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] on a one-month loan on 30 October 2014.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29832347|title=Gary Madine: Coventry re-sign Sheffield Wednesday striker|publisher=BBC Sport|date=30 October 2014|accessdate=30 October 2014}} He scored in the club's 1–0 victory over [[Colchester United F.C.|Colchester United]] on 22 November after scoring his first goal back in the [[Football League Trophy]] tie against [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.]] at the [[Ricoh Arena]]. He was named the club's Player of the Month by [[Coventry Telegraph]] in December, after scoring again in a 2–0 victory over [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]] at [[Vale Park]] on 13 December.{{cite web |url=http://www.coventrytelegraph.net/sport/football/football-news/gary-madine-your-telegraph-coventry-8233487 |title=Gary Madine is YOUR Telegraph Coventry City Player of the Month|publisher=Coventry Telegraph|first=Aidan|last=McCartney|date=5 December 2014 |accessdate=10 February 2015}} ====Blackpool (loan)==== Madine joined [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] on loan until the end of the 2014–15 season on 10 February 2015.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31372174|title=Gary Madine: Sheffield Wednesday striker joins Blackpool|publisher=BBC Sport|date=10 February 2015|accessdate=10 February 2015}} ===Bolton Wanderers=== On 8 June, Madine signed a two-year deal with [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] .{{cite news|url=http://www.theboltonnews.co.uk/sport/wanderers/13318060.Wanderers_set_to_sign_duo_as_Lennon_begins_reeling_in_transfer_targets/|title=Wanderers set to sign duo as Lennon begins reeling in transfer targets|publisher=Bolton News|date=8 June 2015|accessdate=8 June 2015}} On 26 September, he scored his first goal for Bolton in a 2–2 draw with [[Brighton & Hove Albion]].{{cite news|title=Bolton 2–2 Brighton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34299016|accessdate=28 September 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 September 2015}} On 31 May 2017 the club confirmed that Madine had signed a new two-year contract, keeping him at the club until 2019.{{Cite news |title=Madine pens new deal with Whites |url=https://www.bwfc.co.uk/news/2017/may/madine-pens-new-deal-with-whites/ |publisher=Bolton Wanderers Official Site |date=31 May 2017 |accessdate=31 May 2017}} ===Cardiff City=== On 31 January 2018, Madine joined [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] for an undisclosed fee.{{cite web |url=https://www.cardiffcityfc.co.uk/news/2018/january/done-deal--gary-madine-signs-for-the-bluebirds/ |title=Gary Madine signs for the Bluebirds |publisher=Cardiff City F.C. |date=31 January 2018 |accessdate=31 January 2018}} His debut came three days later in a 4–1 win over [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]].{{cite news |title=Leeds United 1–4 Cardiff City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42841902 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 February 2018 |accessdate=3 February 2018}} On 7 January 2019, he joined Championship side [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] on loan for the remainder of the 2018–19 season.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46786641 |title=Gary Madine: Sheffield United sign Cardiff City striker on loan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 January 2019 |accessdate=7 January 2019}} ==Criminal convictions== Madine has been convicted of several assaults. In November 2010 he was found guilty of causing actual bodily harm after attacking a man in a pub and sentenced to community service involving 250 hours of unpaid work. He was also ordered to pay £1,500 compensation to his victim and £1,800 in costs.{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-cumbria-11724475 | title=Carlisle standing by Gary Madine over pub assault | publisher=BBC News | date=10 November 2010 | accessdate=5 October 2013}} In October 2013 he was jailed for 18 months after being found guilty of causing actual bodily harm and grievous bodily harm in two separate attacks.{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-south-yorkshire-24398799 | title=Gary Madine jailed for Sheffield nightclub attacks on fans | publisher=BBC News | date=4 October 2013 | accessdate=5 October 2013}} Madine was released from jail on 20 February 2014 after serving 5 months of his 18-month sentence.http://www.thestar.co.uk/news/crime/disgraced-sheffield-wednesday-striker-released-from-jail-1-6452062 ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 3 November revision.comment: Reverted [[WP:AGF|good faith]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/Thebuzzpomleyfan|Thebuzzpomleyfan]]: Length of period is irrelevant. Why is this penalty miss notable? Thousands of penalties are missed every season. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
revision.text:
{{EngvarB|date=July 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2015}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Omar Bogle | image = | image_size = | caption = | fullname = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1993|7|26|df=y}}{{cite web |url=https://www.wiganathletic.com/news/2017/july/omar-bogle-looking-forward-to-completing-pre-season-against-former-club/ |title=Omar Bogle looking forward to completing pre-season against former club |publisher=Wigan Athletic F.C. |date=25 July 2017 |accessdate=17 August 2017}} | birth_place = [[Sandwell]], England | height = {{height|ft=6|in=3}} | position = [[Forward (association football)|Striker]] | currentclub = [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]]
(on loan from [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]]) | clubnumber = 22 | youthyears1 = 2007–2009 | youthclubs1 = [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] | youthyears2 = 2009–2011 | youthclubs2 = [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] | youthyears3 = 2011–2012 | youthclubs3 = [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] | years1 = 2012 | clubs1 = [[Hinckley United F.C.|Hinckley United]] | caps1 = 8 | goals1 = 3 | years2 = 2012–2015 | clubs2 = [[Solihull Moors F.C.|Solihull Moors]] | caps2 = 111 | goals2 = 62 | years3 = 2015–2017 | clubs3 = [[Grimsby Town F.C.|Grimsby Town]] | caps3 = 68 | goals3 = 32 | years4 = 2017 | clubs4 = [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] | caps4 = 14 | goals4 = 3 | years5 = 2017– | clubs5 = [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] | caps5 = 10 | goals5 = 3 | years6 = 2018 | clubs6 = → [[Peterborough United F.C.|Peterborough United]] (loan) | caps6 = 9 |goals6 = 1 | years7 = 2018–2019 | clubs7 = → [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] (loan) |caps7 = 15 | goals7 = 1 | years8 = 2019– | clubs8 = → [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]] (loan) |caps8 = 8 | goals8 = 4 | nationalyears1 = 2014 | nationalteam1 = [[England C national football team|England C]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | club-update = 08:28, 17 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }} '''Omar Bogle''' (born 26 July 1993) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Striker (association football)|striker]] for {{English football updater|Portsmou}} club [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], on loan from [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] of the {{English football updater|CardiffC}}. Bogle is a former [[England C national football team|England C]] international. He is known for his diversity in physical style of play, strength and holding the ball to bringing others into play. At the age of 14, Bogle started his career with [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]]'s youth system before spending another two years at [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]]'s academy, where he appeared for their [[Birmingham City F.C. Reserves and Academy|reserve team]]. He then spent one year at [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]]'s academy. Bogle returned south of the border in 2011, where he had a trial with [[Luton Town F.C.|Luton Town]], before securing a one-year deal with [[Hinckley United F.C.|Hinckley United]]. During his time there, he caught the attention of [[Solihull Moors F.C.|Solihull Moors]] manager [[Marcus Bignot]], he went on to spend the next three years there winning the [[Conference North]] player of the year in 2014/2015, also the golden boot award after topping the division's goalscoring charts with 29 goals. Bogle had been trialled by [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[AFC Bournemouth]] in July 2013 and having been tried to sign over a two-year period by the management team at [[Grimsby Town F.C.|Grimsby Town]]; at the start of the 2015–16 season he signed a three-year deal with the club and helped Grimsby to win promotion out of the National League, scoring the opening two goals in Grimsby's 3–1 victory over [[Forest Green Rovers]] in the [[2016 National League play-off Final]] at [[Wembley Stadium]], seeing Grimsby [[Promotion and relegation|promoted]] to [[Football League Two|League Two]] after a six-year absence from [[the Football League]], ending the season with 19 goals in all competitions. In November 2016 he was reunited with former manager [[Marcus Bignot]] after the latter was appointed as he new Grimsby Town manager. On [[Transfer window|transfer deadline day]] in January 2017, Bogle was sold to [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] for an undisclosed fee. He moved on to [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] at the end of the season, and spent time on loan at [[Peterborough United]] and Birmingham City before joining Portsmouth, also on loan, in January 2019. ==Club career== Bogle was born in [[Sandwell]], West Midlands. He attended Menzies High School, which later became [[The Phoenix Collegiate]], and started his career with [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]]'s [[youth system]] before moving to the [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] academy, appearing for their [[Birmingham City F.C. Reserves and Academy|reserve team]] when only just 16 years old.{{cite news |title=New regime watch veterans lead Birmingham Senior Cup win |url=http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/new-regime-watch-veterans-lead-105789 |newspaper=Birmingham Mail |date=14 October 2009 |accessdate=13 July 2015}} Released by Birmingham, he played in [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] U17's "Play on the pitch game" in April 2011, scoring a brace against [[Dunfermline Athletic F.C.|Dunfermline Athletic]].{{cite news |title=Rangers 2–1 Dunfermline |url=https://rfcyouths.wordpress.com/2011/04/04/17s-play-at-ibrox/ |website=WordPress.com |publisher=Rangers Youths |date=4 April 2011 |accessdate=28 January 2017}} Bogle moved to [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]]'s academy in September 2011,{{cite news |first=Joe |last=McHugh |title=Celts held by Motherwell |url=http://videocelts.com/2011/09/blogs/younghoops/celts-held-by-motherwell |publisher=Video Celts |date=10 September 2011 |accessdate=13 July 2015}} and played for Celtic Under 19's team in the [[NextGen Series|European Next-Gen Series]].{{cite news |first=Aaron |last=Flanagan |title=5 non-league strikers who could play for England |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/row-zed/5-non-league-strikers-who-could-5739681 |newspaper=The Daily Mirror |location=London |date=22 May 2015 |accessdate=13 July 2015}}{{cite news |first=Mark |last=Henderson |title=Bogle Brace Gives Youths The Spoils |url=http://www.celticfc.net/news/1769?item=1769 |publisher=Celtic F.C. |date=19 November 2011 |accessdate=13 July 2015}} He then returned south in March 2012, to pursue regular first team football.{{cite news |title=Player Profile |url=http://www.grimsby-townfc.co.uk/team/player-profile/omar-bogle/9 |publisher=Grimsby Town F.C. |accessdate=13 July 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151006062223/http://www.grimsby-townfc.co.uk/team/player-profile/omar-bogle/9 |archivedate=6 October 2015}} ===Hinckley United=== Bogle signed for [[Conference North]] side [[Hinckley United F.C.|Hinckley United]] in March 2012.{{cite news |title=Ex-Celtic Striker Joins Knitters |url=http://nonleague.pitchero.com/news/ex-celtic-striker-joins-knitters-11866/ |publisher=Pitchero |date=19 March 2012 |accessdate=13 July 2015}} He made his debut on 19 March 2012 in a 1–3 home defeat against [[Solihull Moors F.C.|Solihull Moors]].{{cite news |first=Ben |last=Eccleston |title=Hinckley United lose their cutting edge as Solihull Moors strike back |url=http://www.hinckleytimes.net/sport/football/football-news/hinckley-united-lose-cutting-edge-6033336 |newspaper=The Hinckley Times |accessdate=13 July 2015}} He scored his first goal for the club with a late winner against [[Vauxhall Motors F.C.|Vauxhall Motors]] on 24 March 2012, Calum Flanagan's throw-in found Bogle with his back to goal 12 yards out, he turned his marker before curling a low shot beyond goalkeeper Scott Tynan into the far corner.{{cite news |title=Hinckley Utd 2–2 Vauxhall Motors |url=http://www.chesterchronicle.co.uk/sport/other-sport/football-hinckley-united-2-vauxhall-5181571 |newspaper=Chester Chronicle |date=28 March 2012 |accessdate=13 July 2015}} On 9 April 2012, he pulled a goal back in the 1–3 home defeat against [[Bishop's Stortford F.C.|Bishop's Stortford]]{{cite news |title=Hinckley Utd 1–3 Bishop's Stortford |url=http://www.coventrytelegraph.net/sport/football/football-news/match-report-hinckley-utd-1-3026108 |newspaper=Coventry Telegraph |date=10 April 2012 |accessdate=13 July 2015}} On 15 April 2012, he scored an equalising goal 11 minutes from time in the 1–1 stalemate at [[Worcester City F.C.|Worcester City]], Bogle gathered the ball 20 yards out, before taking it past a Worcester defender, and shooting from the edge of the area low and beyond the beaten Sargeant.{{cite news |title=Worcester City 1–1 Hinckley Utd |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17716895 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 April 2012 |accessdate=13 July 2015}} Bogle departed The Knitters in July 2012, having made 8 appearances and scoring 3 goals during his time at [[De Montfort Park]].{{cite web |title=O. Bogle |url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/omar-bogle/220871/ |work=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=28 January 2019}} ===Solihull Moors=== On 7 July 2012, Bogle signed for [[Conference North]] side with [[Solihull Moors F.C.|Solihull Moors]]{{cite news |title=Players under Written Contract Registered Between 01/07/2012 and 31/07/2012 |url=http://www.thefa.com/~/media/2FC380172F88401482C3994AF130D59B.pdf |publisher=The Football Association |date=1 August 2012 |format=PDF |accessdate=13 July 2015}}{{cite news |first=Ross |last=Crawford |title=Bignot delighted as Solihull Moors squad return for training |url=http://www.solihullnews.net/sport/football/news/bignot-delighted-solihull-moors-squad-6043741 |newspaper=Solihull News |date=13 July 2012 |accessdate=13 July 2015}} He made his debut for Solihull on 18 August 2012 in the 3–1 away defeat at [[Colwyn Bay F.C.|Colwyn Bay]].{{cite news |title=Colwyn Bay 3–1 Solihull Moors |url=http://www.dailypost.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/blue-square-bet-north-colwyn-2654132 |newspaper=The Daily Post |location=Llandudno |date=20 August 2012 |accessdate=13 July 2015}} On 21 August 2012, he provided an assist and a goal in the 3–0 home tie against [[Corby Town F.C.|Corby Town]], within 15 minutes Bogle collected the ball on the left flank and provided a perfect cross which [[Darryl Knights]] knocked in the first goal, he then scored his first goal for Solihull Moors, on 27 minutes a corner floated into the box and Bogle steered the ball into the net.{{cite news |title=Solihull Moors 3–0 Corby Town |url=http://www.corbytownfc.co.uk/news/2012/solihull-moors-3-0-corby-town/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120826170035/http://www.corbytownfc.co.uk/news/2012/solihull-moors-3-0-corby-town/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=26 August 2012 |publisher=Corby Town F.C. |date=21 August 2012 |accessdate=13 July 2015}}{{cite news |first=Ross |last=Crawford |title=Solihull Moors bounce back with a bang |url=http://www.solihullnews.net/sport/football/news/solihull-moors-bounce-back-bang-6043588 |newspaper=Solihull News |date=24 August 2012 |accessdate=13 July 2015}} On 24 September 2012, he scored an equaliser in the 37th minute, against [[Midland Football Alliance]] side [[Westfields F.C.|Westfields]] in the [[FA Cup]] second round, Ryan Beswick's long-range free-kick floated through a crowd of bodies for Bogle to head home past the keeper.{{cite news |title=Solihull Moors 1–1 Westfields |url=http://www.herefordtimes.com/sport/westfields/reports/9950448.Richard_Kear_goal_earns_Westfields_an_FA_Cup_draw_at_Solihull_Moors/ |newspaper=Hereford Times |date=26 September 2012 |accessdate=15 July 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150715032720/http://www.herefordtimes.com/sport/westfields/reports/9950448.Richard_Kear_goal_earns_Westfields_an_FA_Cup_draw_at_Solihull_Moors/ |archivedate=15 July 2015 |deadurl=yes}} On 26 September 2012, he scored the 2nd goal in the 1–2 win in the second round [[FA Cup]] replay against [[Westfields F.C.|Westfields]], an 89th minute a right wing corner from which Bogle used his strength to force the ball over the line.{{cite news |title=Westfields 1–2 Solihull Moors |url=http://www.herefordtimes.com/sport/9950501.Omar_Bogle_s_late_goal_gives_Solihull_Moors_an_FA_Cup_replay_win_over_Westfields/ |newspaper=Hereford Times |date=26 September 2012 |accessdate=15 July 2015}} Bogle scored a brace in the third round qualifying of the [[2012–13 FA Trophy]] against [[A.F.C. Fylde|AFC Fylde]] on 10 November 2012 in the 18th minute, a cross into the penalty area caused them problems, Bogle and Knights shotes rebounded and eventually fell again to Bogle who side foot into the net from close range; his second came only 3 minutes later, a long throw from Keenah Rosser, which found Bogle who fired the ball low into the left-hand corner of the net, from the edge of the box.{{cite news |title=Solihull Moors 2–1 AFC Fylde |url=http://www.thefa.com/News/competitions/fa-trophy/2012/nov/solihull-moors-afc-fylde-third-round-qualifying-report |publisher=The Football Association |date=10 November 2012 |accessdate=15 July 2015}}{{dead link|date=January 2017}}{{cbignore}} Another 1–2 victory in the [[FA Trophy]], this time over [[Hednesford Town F.C.|Hednesford Town]] a loose ball in midfield was picked up by Bogle in plenty of space, which gave him time to curl a magnificent unstoppable shot over former Solihull keeper Dan Crane from 25 yards out.{{cite news |title=Hednesford Town 1–2 Solihull Moors |url=http://www.hednesfordtownfc.com/2012/11/hednesford-1-2-solihullmoors |publisher=Hednesford Town F.C. |date=26 November 2012 |accessdate=15 July 2015}} He also appeared in the [[FA Trophy]] second round against [[Conference Premier]] side [[Wrexham A.F.C.|Wrexham]], which ended up a 3–2 defeat for Solihull.{{cite news |title=Wrexham 3–2 Solihull Moors |url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/wrexham-3---2-solihull-2014037 |newspaper=The Western Mail (Wales) |date=15 December 2012 |accessdate=15 July 2015}}{{cite news |title=Wrexham 3–2 Solihull Moors |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/wales/20736329 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 December 2012 |accessdate=15 July 2015}} Bogle spent a trial for a week with [[Football League Championship|Championship]] side [[AFC Bournemouth]] in July 2013, where he went on a pre-season training camp in Switzerland and played against [[FC Zürich]], however his trial wasn't progressed any further.{{cite news |title=Cherries beaten in Zurich |url=http://www.afcb.co.uk/news/article/2013-07-05-fc-zurich-match-report-898133.aspx |publisher=AFC Bournemouth |date=5 July 2013 |accessdate=13 July 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609183218/http://www.afcb.co.uk/news/article/2013-07-05-fc-zurich-match-report-898133.aspx |archivedate=9 June 2016 |df=dmy-all}} He then signed up again with Solihull for the upcoming 2013–14 season.{{cite news |title=Players under Written Contract Registered Between 01/08/2013 and 31/08/2013 |url=http://www.thefa.com/~/media/files/thefaportal/governance-docs/registrations/august-2013.pdf |publisher=The Football Association |date=31 August 2013 |format=PDF |accessdate=13 July 2015}} Three games into the 2014/15 season on 16 August 2014, Bogle scored his first two goals, a loose ball in the 63rd minute caused havoc in the penalty area, the ball came to Bogle who was on hand to smash home; Bogle then slotted home for his second of the game from the penalty spot on 71 minutes, Matt Regan conceded a penalty on the edge of the box and Omar to seal all three points.{{cite news |title=Stalybridge Celtic 0–3 Solihull Moors |url=http://www.stalybridgeceltic.co.uk/rep.php?id=12854 |publisher=Stalybridge Celtic F.C. |date=16 August 2014 |accessdate=13 July 2015}} On 20 December 2014, Bogle scored a hat-trick in the 1–4 demolition of [[Colwyn Bay F.C.|Colwyn Bay]], his first came on 10 minutes when a free kick was taken by Ryan Beswick, which Liam Daly duly nodded down in the box for Bogle skillfully rolled the ball into the right hand corner; following a good move out of defence, Colwyn Bay failed to clear in the box and Bogle poked his second of the day; Bogle sweeping on to the loose ball on 36 minutes, after [[Jack Truelove]] gave the ball away in his own half, he curled the shot around the stranded keeper for his hat-trick and Moors third.{{cite news |title=Colwyn Bay 1–4 Solihull Moors |url=http://www.solihullnews.net/sport/football/match-reports/colwyn-bay-1-solihull-moors-8386063 |newspaper=Solihull News |date=5 January 2015 |accessdate=13 July 2015}} Bogle scored his final league goal for the 2014/15 season, an equaliser in the 2–2 draw with [[A.F.C. Fylde|AFC Fylde]], a handball in the box from Josh Langley resulted in a penalty from which Bogle scored with virtually the last kick of the game.{{cite news |title=AFC Fylde 2–2 Solihull Moors |url=http://www.solihullnews.net/sport/football/match-reports/afc-fylde-2-solihull-moors-9083539 |newspaper=Solihull News |date=20 April 2015 |accessdate=13 July 2015}} While at [[Solihull Moors F.C.|Solihull Moors]] Bogle won the [[Conference North]] player of the year, he also won the golden boot award after topping the division's goalscoring charts in 2014/2015 with 29 goals.{{cite news |title=Double Award Win For Moors Star |url=http://www.footballconference.co.uk/news/details.php?news_id=15380 |website=The National League |date=9 June 2015 |accessdate=13 July 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160604110701/http://www.footballconference.co.uk/news/details.php?news_id=15380 |archivedate=4 June 2016 |df=dmy-all}}{{cite news |title=Double Award Win For Moors Star |url=http://www.solihullmoorsfc.co.uk/news/1257-double-award-for-moors-star |publisher=Solihull Moors F.C |date=28 July 2009 |accessdate=13 July 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150708111549/http://www.solihullmoorsfc.co.uk/news/1257-double-award-for-moors-star |archivedate=8 July 2015 |deadurl=yes}}{{cite web |title=National League North Top Scorers |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/conference-north/top-scorers |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=13 July 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150615212201/http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/conference-north/top-scorers |archivedate=15 June 2015}} ===Grimsby Town=== ==== 2015–16 season ==== Bogle joined [[National League (division)|National League]] side [[Grimsby Town F.C.|Grimsby Town]] on 15 June 2015 on a three-year contract for an undisclosed fee.{{cite news |title=Grimsby Town sign highly-rated striker |url=http://www.grimsbytelegraph.co.uk/8203-Grimsby-Town-sign-highly-rated-striker-Omar/story-26700434-detail/story.html |newspaper=Grimsby Telegraph |date=7 March 2015 |accessdate=13 July 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150720055205/http://www.grimsbytelegraph.co.uk/8203-Grimsby-Town-sign-highly-rated-striker-Omar/story-26700434-detail/story.html |archivedate=20 July 2015 |df=dmy-all}} Prior to him signing, he was admist much transfer speculation with numerous clubs reportedly scouting him, Grimsby had outbid a £10,000 sum by [[Nuneaton Town F.C.|Nuneaton Town]] which was rejected by Solihull.{{cite news |title=Nuneaton Town bid for Moors star Bogle |url=http://www.nuneaton-news.co.uk/Nuneaton-Town-Boro-bid-Moors-star-Bogle/story-26655922-detail/story.html |newspaper=Nuneaton News |date=8 June 2015 |accessdate=13 July 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150712224821/http://www.nuneaton-news.co.uk/Nuneaton-Town-Boro-bid-Moors-star-Bogle/story-26655922-detail/story.html |archivedate=12 July 2015 |df=dmy-all}}{{cite news |title=Moors Reject Bogle Bid |url=http://www.solihullmoorsfc.co.uk/news/1258-moors-reject-bogle-offer |publisher=Solihull Moors F.C. |date=9 June 2015 |accessdate=13 July 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150614042252/http://www.solihullmoorsfc.co.uk/news/1258-moors-reject-bogle-offer |archivedate=14 June 2015}} Grimsby Town also fended off interest from Gateshead to sign Bogle.{{cite news |first=Jeff |last=Bowron |title=Gateshead miss out on high-scoring striker Omar Bogle |url=http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/sport/gateshead-miss-out-high-scoring-striker-9466561 |newspaper=Evening Chronicle |location=Newcastle |date=16 June 2015 |accessdate=13 July 2015}} [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] and [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]] in [[EFL League One|League One]] were also confirmed in March 2015 to be weighing up a move for him.{{cite news |first=Mike |last=Baggaley |title=Port Vale weigh up move for Solihull Moors striker Omar Bogle |url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Port-Vale-weigh-Solihull-Moors-striker-Omar-Bogle/story-26216956-detail/story.html |newspaper=The Sentinel |location=Stoke-on-Trent |date=23 March 2015 |accessdate=13 July 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150413013509/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Port-Vale-weigh-Solihull-Moors-striker-Omar-Bogle/story-26216956-detail/story.html |archivedate=13 April 2015 |df=dmy-all}} He made his full debut with Grimsby on 8 August 2015, in the 2–2 draw at [[Kidderminster Harriers F.C.|Kidderminster]].{{cite news |title=Kidderminster 2–2 Grimsby |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33744688 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 August 2015 |accessdate=24 January 2017}} Bogle scored three days later in the 4–1 home thrashing of [[Barrow A.F.C.|Barrow]]; scoring the second goal on 22 minutes, after a mistake in the Barrow defense, he slotted a right footed shot past the keeper to score his first goal for the club.{{cite news |title=Grimsby 4–1 Barrow |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33769091 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 August 2015 |accessdate=25 January 2017}} On 8 May 2016, Bogle scored the winner in the 2–0 win against [[Braintree Town F.C.|Braintree Town]]; with 10 minutes to go of extra time, [[Jon Nolan]] swung in a deep free-kick to the far post and no-one in an Orange shirt had picked up Bogle, with the keeper in no-man's land, Bogle planted a header into the bottom corner; Bogle's goal for Grimsby overturned a 1–0 first-leg deficit, beating Braintree and securing their place in the National League promotion final against Forest Green.{{cite news |title=Braintree 0–2 Grimsby |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36180844 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 May 2016 |accessdate=8 February 2017}} Bogle scored the opening two goals in Grimsby's 3–1 victory over [[Forest Green Rovers]] in the [[2016 National League play-off Final]] at [[Wembley Stadium]], seeing Grimsby [[Promotion and relegation|promoted]] to [[Football League Two|League Two]] after a six-year absence from [[the Football League]].{{cite news |title=Bogle scores twice as Grimsby beat Forest Green in National League play-off final |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/may/15/grimsby-omar-bogle-forest-green-playoff-final |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=15 May 2016 |accessdate=31 May 2016}}{{cite news |last1=Garry |first1=Tom |title=Forest Green 1–3 Grimsby |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36244418 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 May 2016 |accessdate=15 May 2016}}{{cite news |first=Andy |last=Charles |title=Grimsby secure promotion back to Football League at Wembley |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/forest-grn-vs-grimsby/355101 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=15 May 2016 |accessdate=16 May 2016}} ==== 2016–17 ==== Bogle made his [[Football League Two|League Two]] professional debut with Grimsby on 6 August 2016, coming off the subs bench in the opening game of the season, a 2–0 win over [[Morecambe F.C.|Morecambe]].{{cite news |title=Grimsby 2–0 Morecambe |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36930237 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 August 2016 |accessdate=24 January 2017}} His first goal came on his full debut on 16 August 2016, in the 3–2 defeat at [[Colchester United F.C.|Colchester]]; blasting a left footed shot from 18-yards in the second-minute of stoppage time.{{cite news |title=Colchester 3–2 Grimsby |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37018088 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 August 2016 |accessdate=24 January 2017}} Bogle won the [[Professional Footballers' Association|PFA]] Fans' League Two Player of the Month award for August and September 2016.{{cite news |title=Grimsby's Omar Bogle wins PFA Fans' League Two Player of the Month |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/10597908/grimsbys-omar-bogle-wins-pfa-fans-league-two-player-of-the-month |publisher=Sky Sports |date=1 October 2016 |accessdate=13 November 2016}} He was also named in the [[English Football League|EFL]] Team of the Week in August,{{cite news |first=Alex |last=Butcher |title=Sky Bet EFL: Team of the Week |url=http://www.efl.com/news/article/2016/sky-bet-efl-team-of-the-week-3278804.aspx |publisher=EFL |date=29 August 2016 |accessdate=27 November 2016}} September,{{cite news |first=Alex |last=Butcher |title=Sky Bet EFL: Team of the Week |url=http://www.efl.com/news/article/2016/sky-bet-efl-team-of-the-week-3303936.aspx |publisher=EFL |date=12 September 2016 |accessdate=27 November 2016}} October (twice),{{cite news |first=Alex |last=Butcher |title=Sky Bet EFL: Team of the Week |url=http://www.efl.com/news/article/2016/sky-bet-efl-team-of-the-week-3381460.aspx |publisher=EFL |date=24 October 2016 |accessdate=27 November 2016}}{{cite news |first=Alex |last=Butcher |title=Sky Bet EFL: Team of the Week |url=http://www.efl.com/news/article/2016/sky-bet-efl-team-of-the-week-3392305.aspx |publisher=EFL |date=31 October 2016 |accessdate=27 November 2016}} and November 2016.{{cite news |first=Alex |last=Butcher |title=Sky Bet EFL: Team of the Week |url=http://www.efl.com/news/article/2016/sky-bet-efl-team-of-the-week-3428230.aspx |publisher=EFL |date=21 November 2016 |accessdate=27 November 2016}} In January 2017, [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] had 3 separate bids turned down by Grimsby for Bogle,{{cite web |first=Tim |last=Thornton |title=Grimsby reject three Rotherham bids for Omar Bogle |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11747/10745060/grimsby-reject-three-rotherham-bids-for-omar-bogle-sky-sources |publisher=Sky Sports |date=27 January 2017 |accessdate=28 January 2017}} a further bid by the club was also rejected.{{cite news |first=Trevor |last=Green |title=Grimsby Town Transfer News: Fourth Rotherham United bid for Omar Bogle rejected |url=http://www.grimsbytelegraph.co.uk/grimsby-town-new-signing-chambers-makes-his-grand-return-to-blundell-park/story-29439382-detail/story.html |newspaper=Grimsby Telegraph |date=28 January 2017 |accessdate=28 January 2017 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160803205308/http://www.grimsbytelegraph.co.uk/grimsby-town-new-signing-chambers-makes-his-grand-return-to-blundell-park/story-29439382-detail/story.html |archivedate=3 August 2016 |df=dmy-all}} Bogle was also subject of an enquiry by fellow Championship sides [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] and [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]].{{cite news |first=Joel |last=Watson |title=Leeds in three-way scrap for prolific striker: They've made an enquiry |url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/582821/Leeds-transfer-news-Omar-Bogle-target-Garry-Monk |newspaper=Daily Star |location=London |date=28 January 2017 |accessdate=28 January 2017}} [[Premier League]] sides [[Hull City F.C.|Hull]] and [[Swansea City F.C.|Swansea]] joined the race, along with Championship pair [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich]] and [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] for his signature.{{cite news |first=Matt |last=Dannatt |title=Hull City and Swansea City 'join race for Omar Bogle' |url=http://www.grimsbytelegraph.co.uk/grimsby-town-transfer-news-hull-city-and-swansea-city-join-race-for-omar-bogle/story-30096829-detail/story.html |newspaper=Grimsby Telegraph |date=30 January 2017 |accessdate=30 January 2017 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170130141133/http://www.grimsbytelegraph.co.uk/grimsby-town-transfer-news-hull-city-and-swansea-city-join-race-for-omar-bogle/story-30096829-detail/story.html |archivedate=30 January 2017 |df=dmy-all}} ===Wigan Athletic=== On 31 January 2017, Bogle signed for Championship side [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] on a two-and-a-half-year deal for an undisclosed fee;{{cite news |title=Omar Bogle signs for Wigan Athletic |url=http://www.wiganlatics.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/omar-bogle-signs-for-latics-3548660.aspx |publisher=Wigan Athletic F.C. |date=31 January 2017 |accessdate=31 January 2017}} this included a number of additional clauses, if Wigan maintained their Championship status in the current season, return to the [[Premier League]], also a sell-on clause.{{cite news |first=Matt |last=Dannatt |title=How Grimsby Town could continue to profit from Omar Bogle's move to Wigan Athletic |url=http://www.grimsbytelegraph.co.uk/town-thrive-if-the-latics-survive/story-30118428-detail/story.html |newspaper=Grimsby Telegraph |date=8 February 2017 |accessdate=8 February 2017 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170208084916/http://www.grimsbytelegraph.co.uk/town-thrive-if-the-latics-survive/story-30118428-detail/story.html |archivedate=8 February 2017 |df=dmy-all}} Bogle made his first appearance for the club on 3 February 2017 in the 1–0 home defeat against [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]], coming off the subs bench to replace [[Will Grigg]] in the 67th minute.{{cite news |title=Wigan 0–1 Sheffield Wednesday |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38766583 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 February 2017 |accessdate=8 February 2017}} His first goals came when he made his full debut on 7 February 2017, the game finishing a 2–2 draw at home to [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]]; his first came from a header from a [[Michael Jacobs (footballer)|Michael Jacobs]] corner to equalise on 62 minutes, then 6 minutes later he scored from a free-kick from the right side edge of the area into the far corner.{{cite news |title=Wigan 2–2 Norwich |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38805571 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 February 2017 |accessdate=8 February 2017}} Bogle scored his third and final goal of the 2016-17 Championship campaign from the penalty spot in a 2-1 defeat at [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]].{{cite news |title=Queens Park Rangers 2-1 Wigan Athletic |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38964777 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 February 2017 |accessdate=1 August 2017}} ===Cardiff City=== On 17 August 2017, Bogle signed for Championship side [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] on a three-year deal for an officially undisclosed fee,{{cite web |url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/cardiff-city-announce-capture-wigan-13492609 |title=Cardiff City announce capture of Wigan striker Omar Bogle on three-year deal |publisher=WalesOnline |author=Paul Abbandonato |date=17 August 2017 |accessdate=17 August 2017}} although Cardiff manager [[Neil Warnock]] later stated that the transfer fee was £700,000.{{cite web |url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/neil-warnock-omar-bogle-isnt-13495395 |title=Neil Warnock: Omar Bogle isn't a replacement for Kenneth Zohore; Cardiff City ace is not going to Hull City |publisher=WalesOnline |author=Dominic Booth |date=18 August 2017 |accessdate=18 August 2017}} His debut came five days later in a 2–1 loss over [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] in the [[EFL Cup]].{{cite news |title=Cardiff City 1–2 Burton Albion |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40932009 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 August 2017 |accessdate=22 August 2017}} Making his first league start for ''The Bluebirds'', Bogle scored his first goal for the club in a 3–1 win over [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] on 31 October, shortly followed by his second 5 days later against [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]], before being sent off in the [[Severnside Derby]].{{cite news |title=Cardiff City 3–1 Ipswich Town |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41730392 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 October 2017 |accessdate=31 October 2017}}{{cite news |title=Bristol City 2–1 Cardiff City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41785605 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 November 2017 |accessdate=5 November 2017}} Upon his return he scored the third goal in a 3–1 win over [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]].{{cite news |title=Cardiff City 3–1 Norwich City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42105221 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 December 2017 |accessdate=5 December 2017}} On 1 February, Bogle joined [[Peterborough United F.C.|Peterborough United]] on loan until the end of the 2017–18 season.{{cite web |url=https://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/cardiff-city-transfer-deadline-day-14230108 |title=Cardiff City transfer deadline day digest: Gary Madine and Jamie Ward sign as Lee Tomlin, Lee Camp and Omar Bogle depart |publisher=WalesOnline |author=Dominic Booth |date=1 February 2018 |accessdate=1 February 2018}} He scored his first goal for Peterborough in a 2-1 win over [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] on 27 February 2018.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43122535 |title=Peterborough 2-1 Walsall |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 February 2018 |accessdate=28 February 2018}} ===Birmingham City=== On 7 August 2018, Bogle joined [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] on a season-long loan.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45105079 |title=Omar Bogle: Birmingham City sign striker on loan from Cardiff City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 August 2018 |accessdate=7 August 2018}} He made his debut as a second-half substitute in a 1–0 defeat away to [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]],{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45066579 |title=Middlesbrough 1–0 Birmingham City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 August 2018 |accessdate=11 August 2018}} and made three league starts during August. However, as [[Che Adams]] began to develop a productive partnership with [[Lukas Jutkiewicz]]{{snd}}both had ten goals by mid-December{{cite news |url=https://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/birmingham-city-star-says-what-15574315 |title=Birmingham City star says what we've all been thinking about Che Adams |first=Shane |last=Ireland |newspaper=Birmingham Mail |date=19 December 2018 |accessdate=28 January 2019}}{{snd}}Bogle became increasingly peripheral, losing his place on the bench to youngster [[Beryly Lubala]].{{cite news |url=https://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/we-just-ignore-each-other-15248421 |title='We just ignore each other' Every word from Birmingham City boss Garry Monk |first=Brian |last=Dick |newspaper=Birmingham Mail |date=7 October 2018 |accessdate=28 January 2019}} According to manager [[Garry Monk]], not having spent pre-season with Birmingham had made it difficult for Bogle; "he was just so eager to score a goal when he first came in and that probably distracted from the other work that needed to be done." He worked hard to regain a place on the bench,{{cite news |url=https://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/garry-monk-made-claim-birmingham-15598718 |title=Garry Monk has made this claim about Birmingham City goal-getter Omar Bogle |first=Brian |last=Dick |newspaper=Birmingham Mail |date=26 December 2018 |accessdate=28 January 2019}} and scored his first goal for the club on 26 December with a shot from distance to secure a 2–0 home win against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]].{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46614466 |title=Birmingham City 2–0 Stoke City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 December 2018 |accessdate=27 December 2018}} === Portsmouth === Bogle's loan at Birmingham was cancelled by mutual agreement on 28 January 2019, and later that day he joined [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]] of League One on loan until the end of the season.{{cite web |url=https://www.bcfc.com/news/articles/2019/omar-bogle-leaves-blues/ |title=Omar Bogle leaves Blues |publisher=Birmingham City F.C. |date=28 January 2019 |accessdate=28 January 2019}}
{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47033649 |title=Omar Bogle: Cardiff striker joins Portsmouth on loan after spell with Birmingham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 January 2019 |accessdate=28 January 2019}} He scored on his debut the next day in a defeat away to [[Luton Town F.C.|Luton Town]],{{cite news |url=https://www.portsmouth.co.uk/sport/football/pompey/bogle-not-satisfied-with-encouraging-portsmouth-debut-1-8791315 |title=Bogle not satisfied with encouraging Portsmouth debut |first=Neil |last=Allen |newspaper=The News |location=Portsmouth |date=30 January 2019 |accessdate=7 February 2019}} and produced an equaliser against [[Doncaster Rovers]] on his [[Fratton Park]] home debut in his next match.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47011140 |title=Portsmouth 1–1 Doncaster Rovers |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 February 2019 |accessdate=7 February 2019}} ==International career== Bogle was selected and called up to the [[England national football C team|England C]] team in 2014, to play against [[Estonia national under-23 football team|Estonia U23]]'s.{{cite news |title=England C name squad for Estonia clash in Halifax |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/development/2014/nov/england-c-announce-squad-for-estonia-clash |publisher=The Football Association |date=10 November 2014 |accessdate=13 July 2015}} On 18 November 2014, Bogle opened the scoring after just four minutes and nodded down for [[Harry Beautyman]] to notch number two. He was substituted midway through the second half but not before seeing another shot blocked off the line; he left the pitch to a loud applause from the crowd.{{cite news |title=England C overcome Estonia U23s at The Shay |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/development/2014/nov/england-c-edge-estonia-23s |publisher=The Football Association |date=19 November 2014 |accessdate=13 July 2015}} ==Style of play== Bogle primarily plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|central striker]], he can dribble, hold the ball up, scores headers. he also has the ability to play with both his left foot and his right, a great skill for footballers.{{cite news |first=Michael |last=Beardmore |title=Former Birmingham City striker is the 'best striker in non-league' says ex-Lambs coach Byfield |url=http://www.tamworthherald.co.uk/Tamworth-face-best-striker-non-league-says-coach/story-25763551-detail/story.html |newspaper=Tamworth Herald |date=25 December 2014 |accessdate=13 July 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150615225153/http://www.tamworthherald.co.uk/Tamworth-face-best-striker-non-league-says-coach/story-25763551-detail/story.html |archivedate=15 June 2015 |df=dmy-all}} ==Trivia== Omar Bogle's chant by [[Grimsby Town F.C.|Grimsby Town]] fans is a version of the song [[Tender (song)|Tender]] by the band [[Blur (band)|Blur]].{{cite news |first=Matt |last=Dannatt |title=Omar Bogle's new Grimsby Town chant is brilliant |url=http://www.grimsbytelegraph.co.uk/listen-omar-bogle-serenaded-with-new-chant-at-notts-county/story-29683958-detail/story.html |newspaper=Grimsby Telegraph |date=5 September 2016 |accessdate=29 January 2017 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160905140606/http://www.grimsbytelegraph.co.uk/listen-omar-bogle-serenaded-with-new-chant-at-notts-county/story-29683958-detail/story.html |archivedate=5
